text: On tap at Akkurat. Tart, woody and earthy taste. Apple core, apple cider vinegar and hints of elderflowers. Dry, medium bitter aftertaste.

750ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, dark golden colour with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Aroma is dominated by elderflower notes, more or less typical Lambic basis. Taste is dry, tart, slightly tangy, predomination of elderflower again, laying on a basis of vinegar, soup cube, lovage, grape juice, a dry, woody touch as well.
Bottle at Portland tasting. Soft head, dark amber gold. Good lambic funk. Elderflower and dust. Sweet, funk. Fantastic. Dry, grassy light herbal sweetness. Delicious. Great dry and understated.

Bottle pour at ACBF2017/Gainsbar, 2011 Vintage. Pours cloudy golden, small white head. Cellar, fruity, funk, sour, wood, smooth. Perfumish aroma. Moderate+ acidity, dry finsh. Average to high carbonation. Very good, but definitely not my favorite from Cantillon.

Sample at Ölrepubliken during GBG Beer Week 2017. Hazy yellow golden with white head. Sour funky with distinct elderberry flowers. Strangely the taste changes with every sip, from rather sweet elderberry flower lemonade to very sour funky lambic to elderberries. Dry medium sour with medium carbonation.

2012 vintage bottle from In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst. Pours out golden with a ring of a head. Nose is full on elder flowers herbal notes spice funky dust and barrel. Taste is more of the rounded out elder floral notes plenty spice and a nice sour funk. I am typically not a big fan of this one but I guess 5 years on it to round out is the trick.

Bottle--thanks, sebltje! Sour, herbal orange blossom aroma with a little celery. Hazy orange under a white sheet. Complex sour and slightly oaky flavour with a citrusy floral character that comes in late and lasts through the finish. Medium light body, medium high carbonation, crisp and slightly mouth puckering.

Van t vat. Donker goudblond met witte schuimkraag. Geur: zurig, hout. Smaak: zurig, hout, lichte tannine bitterheid. Medium volmondig. Sprankelende koolzuurprikkel. Toen ik dit bier 2 jaar geleden van de fles proefde was ik er weg van en had ik duidelijk vlierbloesem, van t vat blijkbaar niet?

Bottle shared at Cantillon. Clear golden pour with a white head. Notes of basil, raw vegetables, lambic funk, citrus, elderflower cordial. A very interesting and refreshing lambic, quite different from all the other lambics I have tried.

Golden color with minimal head. Aroma has sour fruits, vinegar, lactose. Taste is fruity with long bitter aftertaste. Flavors of fruits, sour apples, cherries.
Bottle 75cl @ Stapa brewpub. Pours lightly hazy golden, no head. Earthy, tart, smooth aroma. Tart, earthy flavor too. Very nice.
Semi hazy golden liquid, large head. Aroma of flowers. Light body, little bit carbonation. Taste is sour and very special.
Bottle: Poured a hazy gold with white. Pungent floral aroma. Taste elderflower, light drinkable tartness.

Botella @In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst 04/12/16 Bottled: 26/07/2013
Color dorado, aromas epeciados, sabores acidos y florales, rica.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Podobny profil do Vigneronne, ale przy tym mega ziołowe w smaku, z wyraźną goryczką. Świetne.

duft svag funk frisk citrus kant en msule blomster nøder en kant af stal hø grøn kant
smag frisk lime citrus blomster frisk smag lidt syrlig eftersmag dog stadig sødme og malt profil

Flaska från Beergium. 2014 vintage. Djup lite söt och syrlig fläderdoft som från flädersaft, ingen fläderbomb men också citrus, stall och fat. Ganska mjuk syra, en hel del citrus med en lätt beska i eftersmaken och så väl integrerad fläder. riktigt gott.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2016 F: thin, white, quick gone.
C: gold, hazy.
A: elderflower, woody, with light typical lambic tones.
T: mostly elderflower, herbal, woody, brett, tart on the palate, medium body, good carbonation, I like this herbal lambic, 7,5dcl bottle shared @ Cantillon in Brussels.
Fľaa pivovar Cantillon, Brusel. Tmava zlata farba, slaba biela pena. Vona bazova, pozadie kysle. Chut sladka bazova, dochut kysla, jemne citrusova. Chutne.

Bottle at the brewery. Very fresh, juicy, natural elderflower flavour - moderate in intensity and more or less defining the beer. There is underlying subtle funk and only light sourness, but mostly a very pleasant and easy drinking elderflower beer.
Bottle from Cantillon. Hazy orange golden color with medium white head. Aroma of elderflower, bayrnard, earthy notes. Tart taste with elderflower, oranges, earthy notes, herbal, bitter. Tasty.
Bottle at Cantillon. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of elderflower. Taste is sour, elderflower, very herbal, bitter.

Clear golden yellow beer with smallish head leaving to the sides of the glass. Aroma has herbs, elderflower sure. Zesty citrus and sour apple notes. Taste has elderflower, herbs, grass and sourness. Medium body and low carbonation makes this a bit too juicy. Not for me I guess.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Crisp clear. Flowery aroma. Herby boogie. I like the elderflower. Slightly watery palette. Gently sour.
Bottle at Cantillon. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma dominated by elderflower. Again the taste is dominated by elderflower contributing to bitterness, slightly tart sour, clean, very dry/bitter.

Bottle at Stadin Panimo. Amber color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, elderflower, tart, chili, a bit of toast and grass. Soir finish with citrus, elderflower, toast, tart and grass. Excellent lambic.

Draft pour at Thin Mans 2016 Zwanza Day. Pours a mildly hazy orange gold with a small foamy white head. Aroma was very sour and tart, hay, barnyard, vinegar, floral. Flavor follows with sour vinegar up front, hay, grassy, flowers, and funky. Light body and texture, bubbly carbonation, very dry and tart finish. Definitely grew on me as I drank this one. Long time want so it was nice to see it on tap that day.

Had this at the Zwanze Day Celebration and didnt really get enough of a sample to do a good enough job reviewing. But from what I did get- beer was more tart than sweet. Couldnt get much if any elderflower. Finished a bit dry. Just kind of a basic lambic that wasnt bad, but nothing special.

On tap at Zwanze Day at Crooked Stave. Hazy bronze color, with a medium, persistent, creamy head. Strong herbal character, hard cheese, and lemon peel. Dry and nicely tart flavor, with a bit of sweetness leading to a clean finish. Light to medium body, sticky, astringent, and only a little acidic. This is a unique and interesting lambic. I was unimpressed at first, but it grew on me.

On tap at Jester King Zwanze Day celebration. Pours a slightly hazy light golden color with white fizzy head. Floral notes, citrus, funk, and some tartness on the nose; follows onto the palate. Light and crisp on the palate. Finishes with floral notes and citrus, ending with tartness and dry.

Draft->tumbler at Sovereign on Zwanze Day 2016. Slightly hazy orange with bare head. Tart and slight funk, with herbal and floral notes unlike other Cantillons I have had; I like the zestiness, but the herbal notes are a touch offputting to me.

Really fresh bottle, just 4 months old. Hazy golden color with a bit of off-white foam. Aroma is fruity and floral mostly with a quite clean yeast funk. Taste follows with the fruity notes, mostly stonefruits, hay, quite bitter finish, really earthy. Quite soft mouthfeel for a lambic. Quite good lambic with a very nice mouthfeel.

Lucky enough to have tried this a few times in Brussels and at Himmeriget. Lots of elderflower -- together with the lambic there are acidic notes as well as brett, honeysuckle, and lemon. Super dry mineral and grassy aftertaste. Palate is just perfect. Perfectly executed.

Sample at Zwanze Day 2016 at Jolly Pumpkin. Aroma is funk, floral, tart, spicy, fresh peppers, very weird. Appearance is golden, clear, white head. Taste is pepper, floral, funk, barnyard, eh. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, funk pepper aftertaste. Overall, this one is weird.

Draught at Akkurat, Zwanse 2016.
Hazy bright yellow with a white head.
Floral citric acidic aroma with lemons and green apples and brett.
Taste is fresh floral citrus with brett and wood and some vinegar.
Medium to light body with soft tickling carbonation and dry texture.
Very refreshing and summery. Nice as always.

Draught @ Himmeriget, vintage 2016. Hazy golden with an off white head. Elderflower aroma with apples and barnyard in aroma. Tart apple flavour with a sweet elderflower touch and citrus notes and a touch of bitterness. Fresh.

Hazy tan orange... Aroma of funk, weeds, fresh cut grass, barnyard... Flavor is funk, earthy, grassy, lots of flowers and weedy notes... Some spices, barnyard funk on finish... Delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Erzbierschof Zurich at Vintage Tasting Zwanze 2016, 2016 vintage. Lots of elderflower, very fresh and citric fruity. Some sourness and a bit tart, but rather light in this respect. Soft carbonation, but still rather much. One of the most accessible lambics I had in a long time.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Keg. Hazy golden, medium sized white head with good retention. Elderflower, wood, barnyard, citrus, minerals. Fine texture, mild sweetness with balanced sourness. I am not a huge fan of elderflower, but this has a lot more to offer.

Tap into a wineglass showing moderately filtered honey orange and sparse white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of brett, apricot, and light floral notes.

The palate is moderately carbonated and lightly carbonated. Very gently tart with flavors of dried apricot and very light bell pepper in the background.
Pours golden yellow with a small fluffy white head. Aroma is amazing, herbal, funk, earthy and floral. Taste manages to be tart, sweet and sour. Medium bodied with a dry finish. Very nice.

750 mL bottle. 2011 bottle. Originally reviewed 9/29/2013.

Pale hazy orange body. Nice big white head. Lasts forever as a pillow of foam.

Hmm. Smells of green peppers. Grassy. Grainy. Lemony acids.

Taste has green peppers t00. Kinda malty. Sour. Grassy green sourness.

Well carbonated. Seems heavier than other Cantillons.

Still no idea what an Elderflower should taste or smell like, but this smells and tastes like green peppers.
Butelka, rocznik 2013. Bardzo fajny i intensywny aromat dziki, zestowy, skórzany, z lekką sugestią bzu. Smak średnio kwaśny i wytrawny, w smaku zest, winogrona, agrest, skóra i nuta bzu. Dobra rzecz.

2016 version. A 500ml pour on tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels into a Cantillon gueuze glass. It was a clear-ish golden orange colour with a two finger white head that had excellent retention and nice lacing. Nose is mainly sour, flowery and grape. (I have no idea what elderflower smells like, so Ive described it as a generic flowery). Tastes of grape, white wine notes, flowers, grape gummy candy, sour and funky. Light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall this was nice and I would drink more, but its not my favourite lambic.
2014 Pours a clear light gold color with a strong white head. Elderflower nose and floral flavor. Strong

26/07/2016 - draught @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels.
Clear at the bottom, hazy above orange with nice white head. Nose is flowers, sour, fruity, citrus. Tase is grains, flowers, gently sour, faint burn, yoghurt. This is absolulately stunning. Could one rate this below 4? Ill go for a 4.9 because I hope theres still a better Cantillon out there but its definetly worth a 5.

Bottle at a share. This has all of Cantillons trademarks -- puckering tartness tempered by a light body, high carbonation, and a good amount of funky barnyard Brett -- but the elderflower adds a very subtle fruitiness that softens everything out. Quite a nice treat.

Bottle from 2013 and 2014. 2013 got +2 in Palate.
2014: Aroma is light tart with elderflowers. Yellow colour with white head, not lasting. Taste is light sour with light elderflower. Light body, dry feel, sour elderflower and maybe tiny sulphur in finish. 6/10 - 4/5 - 7/10 - 3/5 - 15/20

2013: More yeasty/earthy aroma, more vinegar, still some elderflowers. Same appearence. Tasta has a little sweetness too compared to 2014. Same palate, except finish is better. 7/10 - 4/5 - 7/10 - 5/5 - 15/20

203 rating is added.

Bouteille 750ml, 2012, au Québec Ratebeer Gathering. Couleur jaune dorée trouble, mousse blanche. Arôme floral, un peu funky, champignon, boisé, fermier. Goût de levures sauvages, floral, acidité moyenne, un peu fruité. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen.

Bottle (750 ml) @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen 20160514. [ Vintage 2014 ]. Fruity and bretty, woody and acidic, elderflowers, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry and woody with elderflowers. Really nice.
UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Bottle @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen 14/5-16. Fruity with a lot of elderflowers, also bretty and acidic. Dry and fruity with brett and elderflowers.

De moi à moi pour mes 37 ans. Vintage 2012. Un nez surnaturel de fleurs, de raisins blancs, de pissenlit. Aucune note aigre ne me parvient. Je suis dans un jardin de fleurs, bien loin de la Brasserie Cantillon. Je cherche avec la plus grande détermination la Signature de la Brasserie dans cet ouragan darômes vers et ne la trouve pas. Cest bien la Cantillon qui sent le moins la Cantillon quil mait été donné de déguster! Des arômes végétales de concombre, de petit cornichon. Une bière qui appartient à une catégorie à part. Des saveurs orientées vers un légume vert très amer. Jai limpression dune salade de feuilles de radis, de pissenlit. Une quantité importante de pollen et de poivre blanc concassé. Magnifiquement amère, une bière quil me faudra déguster à nouveau, tant cette dégustation maura déstabilisé.
This beer is very divisive but it has grown on me over the years. The nose is very strange; elderflower and green peppers dominate the nose. Light body and high carbonation.

Light cloudy yellow orange. Light floral, some socks. Light bitterness. Some sweetness. Medium body, light carbonation. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, march 14th 2015. Hazy light orange body with white lacings. Aroma is funky with elderflower and peach, taste of barnyard, grapefruit, flowers. As sour as expected, but the fruity flower taste adds a layer of fresh juicyness. Sour funk aftertaste. Extremely nice.

Bottle, 2011, drunk 2/5/16. Huge thanks to James for opening this!Lightly murky, drab copper with some brighter hay tones throughout. Huge white head, even decanting the beer, that slowly fades to cover.Unmistakable elderflower in the nose combines with perfumey brett notes, tons of basement/cellar character and a light touch of wood. Its bright, pervasive and true to Cantillons fruit lambics, very fruit-forward (in this case flower-forward). Elderflower, being quite powerfully aromatic, seems to find a good match in the ripe and earthy funk that Cantillon lambics bring to the table and its incredibly unique smelling the interplay of both.Delightful carbonation, tight and natural as always, helps spread this magnificently flavorful elderflower all over the palate, while lactic and brett acids somewhat match the intensity providing their own funky punch. At 5 years of age, this is still very vibrant and strong and Id be very hard-pressed to imagine this being optimal to drink when brand new. The elderflower is a very strong flavor component that easily (and has almost always) turns things astringent when not carefully controlled. While it is here done very well, there are still some touches of bland nuttiness, soap/oil and light astringency that are inevitable from its use. Wood/oak and mature barnyard flavors abound behind the elderflower and the beer is an absolute joy to drink. Experimental and fun, yet well-executed.

Bottle at RBWG. It pours a hazy yellow color. The aroma has some foresty herbals and flowers. A little earthy with a hint of acid. The flavor is earthy with some notes of sage and herbs. Nice soft funk and barrel notes. Typical Cantillon acidity. Very different from their other lambics. I liked it a lot.

750ml bottle March 2014 vintage pours semi clear slightly hazy orange with a finger of head. Nose is weird sweaty funk, ripe green pepper, light spice, grain and lemon. Taste is very strong weird green pepper spice, japapeno, vegetal herbs, grassy lemon and orange funk, finishes lingering green pepper, funky orange doughy grain and spicy grass. Medium tartness throughout. Could not finish my glass. Very unpleasant experience for me personally.

Bottle, 2014. Pours clean, light yellow in colour, no head. Aroma of flowers, funk, vinegar, barnyard. In taste medium sour with barnyard and flowery notes. Light body, high carbonation, oily texture. Very good.
2013 vintage pours orange golden, slight haze, white foam head. Flowers and slight funk nose. Taste has lots of flowers, slight blue cheese, light sourness. Body is light with some acid.
Bottle 75 cl @ akkurat Stockholm. Pours a light golden colour beer with a medium head. Intense elderflower notes gracefully mixed with notes of brett and green apples. Dry bretty finish
Super lekker! Witte druiven, vlierbloesem, zuur, erg bloemig. Enorme smaakbeleving voor relatief laag ABV. Backlog from 2015/03/29.

Never rated for some reason. Poured at the Shelton Fest in St. Pete, FL. Pours a slight pinkish amber in a small snifter. Small head. Aroma is some acidity, slight vinegar, flowers, cereal, vein cheese, and light fruits. Taste is up front in the acidity, cereal, cheese and then backs into the funky and the flowers. Lively card, somewhat dry. Really good flavors as always from Cantillon. Probably not my favorite but Id still drink a keg a week of this.

Hazy, amber colored, medium- off white head, good lasting. Aroma is ripe fruit, tart, vinegar, flowery petal, elderflower. Taste is medium- sweet malt, ripe fruit and tart, elderflower, flowery, medium+ sourness mixed with medium bitterness, dry, some funk and bit citric. Medium- bodied, average carbonation. (bottle, Gainsbar, Kortrijk)

Pours a slightly cloudy rosé color with golden orange edges and a pillowy two finger head that has great retention, only slowly fading into a lasting cap. Streaks of soapy lacing left behind. 

Funky barnyard aroma with a strong floral presence along with some lactic funk, dry oak and earthy bugs. Subtle barrel/oak presence but the flower petals and lactic funk/cheesiness really stand out. Very faint acetic character but not solvent like or vinegary smelling. 

Medium bodied with a dry, musty barnyard funk presence that lingers over light fruit notes, pale malts, musty brett and toasted oak into a slightly acetic, dry finish. The sourness is kind of tame but there is a lot of farmhouse/barnyard character and lactic funk, especially creamy cheesiness in the back end. Flower petals are also really prominent adding an odd, lingering bitterness. Not overly complex or as sour as I like from cantillon but packs plenty of funky bitterness and unique flavor.
Bottle at Moeder Lambic. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma is, floral, elderflower, seems tart, wood, earthy . Taste is a bit on the sweet side, lots of floral notes, a bit of bread.

Bottle pours light hazy golden, with a white head. Aroma of funk, elderflower, basil, tart, funky. Taste is elder, sour, quite sweet with elder flower, lacks some tartness, but overall a pretty complex and balanced beer.

Sampled at The Festival in Florida. Aroma: lots of flower mixed with some apples and a tiny black pepper touch. App: hazy pale golden, no head. Taste and palate: light to medium body, vinous, medium acidity finish. Overall: perfect palate and awesome taste. Didnt taste the flowers that I had in the nose.

Had bottle and at brewery. Pours brute orange hazy yellow. Not much head but some lacing. Aroma of oak and spring flowers with a green apple undertone. Flavor is tart musty and oak. Very light oak and tart. Finishes dry lemon peel and mouth puckering. Excellent.
Trübes dunkel goldenes Bier mit einer geringen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch sehr sauer fruchtig, kraut Beeren. Geschmack fruchtig säuerlich, Beeren, kraut.

Draft at akkurakt 
Clear yellow, minimal white head.
Aroma of elderflower, cellar and citrus.
Taste nice if elderflower, some bitterness, fizzy fresh, tart and so nice!

Draft at akkurat
Elderflower, heavy sour, medium bitter, long finish. Nice, could drink tons of this

Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, vintage 2014. Pours a hazy orange with a good, off-white head. Aroma is peach, appleskin. Taste is fairly sour, light apricot,light fruity sweetness, appleskin. floweriness.

750mL bottle pours a hazy golden/orange with a large off-white head. Aroma of oak, Brett, horseblanket, mild floral spice. Taste similar to aroma, light easy drinking, nice level of flower, dry with mild sweetness. Nice.
2014 750mL bottle from Moeder Lambic. Poured clear deep orange with white head. Aroma floral lemon tart sour yeast. Light carb med bod quite smooth. Tastes little bitter burnt toast yeast funk.

Bottle shared by "hannont". Colour...light, hazy straw with a thin wisp of a head. Nose...decidedly fruity and lightly funky with yeasty notes as well. Palate...massively sour while still being dry and fruity. Floral notes abound and theres a spritzy feel about the palate. The finish is long and tart.
750ml bottle from May 2014. Wonderful gooseberry aroma. Mildly sour and full of gooseberry flavor (which I guess is what the elderflower tastes like). The flavors balance so well together.
From 750ml bottle. Hazy golden color with white head. Funky bretty aroma, barnyard, dusty, wood, floral, light fruity. Sweet and acidic taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle in garden, 2nd August 15. Pours clear, aroma is sweet and sour, floral perfume. Taste is delicious floral notes, not overly sour, but still enough to keep it interesting. Really great Cantillon and very different from the others.

(750ml 2014 bottle @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, July 27 2015) Pours a hazy pale gold with a small lingering white head and lace. Aroma has elderflower, cut grass, lemon rind, pickle, yellow plum, barnyard, medicinal herbs, some wood. Flavour is quite delicate and elegant. Lots of cut grass, flowers, very fresh. Some of that fresh pickle character, soft lactic sourness. Finish has a bunch of flowers and fresh vegetation. Light to medium body, soft effervescent carb. The floral characters make this delicate and very pleasant, fresh, the much-maligned pickle is no issue in my opinion. A different fruit lambic but a really enjoyable sipper.

Bottle, 75cL. Home. Trade with Erickok. Many thanks!!! 15°C. A nearly clear yellow orange beer with a medium white head ; poor retention. Spicy aroma (heather), woody, floral, acid, smoky. Light sweet, medium sour ; herbal bitter note ; balanced. Light body, thin silky texture, soft carbonation, sweetsour finish, light herbal. Overall, really good fruity floral lambic ; quite drinkable ; good balance between sugary and acid notes.
Bottle at home. Clear golden color with a small white head. Elderflower, lemonade, green apples, lemon, light barnyard, yeast, funk. Nice sourness.

Pours gold with a large fading head.
Nose shows funky notes, pronounced elderflower, peppery characters, perfume-like.
Flavours include more pepper, some elderflower-derived capsicum notes, more floral perfume, followed by a refreshing tartness.

Keg @ In De Wildeman. Hazy golden color. White head. Aromas - from the glass: bretty, sour, poop. Better retronasal: sour, fruity, light wheat, woody. Flavor is sour, with a very light fruity sweetness. Light bodied. Finishes dry, bretty, light bitter.
Clear golden color with no head. Nose is elderflower, elderflower lemonade, tart apples, bit of lemon, slight barnyard. Flavour is classic cantillon sourness with elderflower fresh flowers.

Delt 0,75 l flaske. Disig rødgyllen kropp med et høyt lyst gyllent skum. Friske, fruktige villgjærtoner i nesa toppet av moden pære. Syrlig smak med hylleblomst og treaktige peppertoner. Medium fylde.
A: Elderflower. apple, cherry T: Elderflower, apple, gojiberries O: Nice tartness, some bitterness. Less Elderflower than expected, but very nice!

Aroma of strong elderflower, light barnyard and doughy honey notes, incredibly inviting. Taste is lots of elderflower, nice bitterness and a peppery harsh horseradish like tearing as it goes down your throat, bitterness is almost like wood bitterness, this has beer seemingly has more oak character than other Cantillons, and to me is also among the best fruited with Lou Pepes.

Mamouche 14 vintage

Pours a clear, sun yellow color, with a small white head, producing a ring of lacing.

The aromas reveal flowery green pepper, wild honey and dandelions among a well pronounced barnyard funkiness. The beers sourness is easily recognizable on its own, while it blends really well into the dough flowers, without overpowering their nuances, highlighting the beers subtle qualities. Produces a certain wine gum aroma, without turning sweet at all, exhibiting old hops and dusty malts.

Has a lower carbonation, with a slick finish among a pleasantly light bodied beer, with a nice tart refreshing mouthfeel to it. 

The taste offers dusty malts among leather and a lemony tang, among matured grassy hops and a brett infused tartness. This foundation gets lended more depth by the addition of young green pepper, wet flowers and a whiff of wild honey. Pushes the flavors into a slick dryness, while featuring a unique blend of flowers and herbs, with green pepper tying the taste together. Finishes with a lemon peel infused sourness, creating a dry crispness, together with earthy malts, showcasing slightly toasted green pepper in the very back end of the palate.

This is a very unique beer, as it creates an unforeseen melange of great flavors, ranging between flowers, honey and fresh green pepper, blending together to a fantastic lambic. It tastes very refreshing, while it reveals a lovely depth of flavors, which makes this a gulper and a sipper at the same time.

Draft. Amber beer with a cream head. Tart and sour aroma. Tart and sour flavor with earth and light herbal notes. Medium bodied. Tart/sourness lingers with light acetic notes, earth, and light herbal notes.

Bottle. Hazy gold/orange with a whiteish head. Earthy bitterness (the elderflowers I presume) with Mint, grapefruit, oak and barnyard funk. All flavors very well balanced together. Soft mouthfeel and not overly acidic. Highly drinkable. Spectacular and unique.

Un superbe lambic au nez complexe et élégant qui allie sureau, fleur de sureau, lambic et note de houblon. Bouche tout en fruit et fraîcheur, de la puissance, de léquilibre, de la longueur et de la complexité.

Bottle to glass at the brewery. Pours a slightly hazy straw golden color. Has a decent sour nose with big spicy floral notes. Touch of sour in the flavor, but overpowered by the Elderflower spiciness. Very unique. Nothing like any of the other Cantillon offerings, but I like it.
2014 bottle. Pours a cloudy amber color with no head at all. Tart aroma with a strong floral finish. Medium sour taste with a floral mix in the balance. Amazing beer. Light sourness. Love this beer!

2015/04/19 - On tap at Le Fine Mousse in Paris. Pours a cloudy, dark orange/honey colour with a small white head that quickly disappears. No lacing. Aroma is wood, floral tones, apple, peach, funk, orange and straw. Taste follows nose with wood, straw, funk, and tart apple, orange, citrus and peach. Mouthfeel is thin to medium and silky with mildly biting carbonation and a funky finish that is tart and drying. Really good stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at la fine mousse, paris. Copper color, white head. Aroma is fruity, sour apples, earthy notes. Sour fruity taste, apples and other fruits. Lemon notes.
Bottle brought from the brewery, 2014 edition. Very funky, sour fruit, grape-like, perfect at this weather in the sun.

Shared at Dangerous Bottlehsare #8. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of green apples, elderflower, lots of floral notes, funky cheese, stable, pine, tropical fruits, light peach, straw. Taste is green apples, elderflower, peach, mandarine, citrus, vinegar, hay, funk, straw.
Superb beer. Very well balanced, great fruity nose of elderflower, which also nicely present in the taste. Nice soureness. Great!
Pours a clear golden yellow with an orange glow. Head was minimal with no retention. Aroma is green apples, funk, lemon. Taste is elderflower, slightly citric, apple and grapes.

Shared bottle. Hazy golden with big white head that leaves a nice ring. Wood, hay, sour grains, dough, light herbal, flowery, grapes, very funky. Taste is light sweet with above medium sourness and a light woody bitter finish. Oh yeah, this is really good. The elderflowers are not too dominant at all and work really well here.

Au Saint-Bock... Enfin la chance de goûter à la Mamouche! Au nez cest fruité, floral, et tout en subtilité. Je ne savais pas à quoi mattendre des fleurs de sureau et franchement je ne suis pas déçu. Cest prèsque difficile à croire quil ny ait pas plus de bières les utilisant : le résultat est spectaculaire! Au nez les notes légères sintensifient alors que la bière se réchauffe mais cest  en bouche quelles sépanouissent réellement... Cest un vrai délice. Jai même envie de chercher pour voir sil se vend de ces fleurs de sureau pour les utiliser comme épices! Le côté gueuze et acidulé supporte parfaitement les saveurs. Mium!

Bottle @ Home in Berlin


Appearance: Hazy golden body, thin white head

Aroma: Elderflower is really dominant, some lemon citrus, floral

Taste: Elderflower is more pronounced than expected, tart lemon, funk

Palate: Sharp carbonation, dry finish
Bottle. Golden-orange colour with white head. Floral, citric, wood aroma. Same taste, slightly sour and fruity. Medium body. Really good.

Bottle at the brewery. Pours a hazy amber with a clean white head. Big hit of elderflowers both on the nose and palate. Super fresh and vibrant. Superb balanced tartness with a dry finish. Fine carbonation. Really a special beer.

Ambery yellow golden pour. Aroma of elderflower, bitterhops and even some sirupy tangy scent of agave intertwined with the elderflower. Medium to low carbonation with hints of hops, citrus, rubarb, lemon, soft aftertaste of elderflower that mellows out magnificently. Balanced, soft but tangy this 2014 Mamouche. Normally dontt like ef. but here it has a humble but round presence. Especially present in olfaction. Drink fresh or experiment and age 5-10 years.

Hazy golden color with a white head. Big aroma hits you with fresh elderflowers, some rhubarb notes and some nice funky sourness notes aswell. The taste is really well balanced between the sourness and the juicyness from the elderflowers. Light to medium body.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!
Clear crystal body. Fizzy head. Nose of grass, peach, ... Moderately sour flavour. Very well balanced.

Bottled. Hazy orangeish golden colour, not too much head. Aroma is citrus, dry wood, tart berries and some farmyardy notes. Flavour is famryard, sour/tart wood and some berries along with some yeast and mild parfumed soap (though not all too sweet such).
Amber hazy with minimal white head. Sour fruity aroma. Rich sour taste with strong notes of blackcurrant leaves, carbonated.

On tap during Brussels vacation, vintage 2014, smoking fresh. Aroma and taste is lovely with loads of elder flower, nice bretty notes and tart/acidic notes that balances up the flowers. Loses the fresh flowery notes fairly quickly, drink fresh!

Fantastisk fläder smak, & fin doft. Surhet upp över öron, fantastisk syra. Väl vald öl.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014 bottle shared at home, bought from the brewery in December 2014. Pale pour, pillowy white head. Bright floral elderflower aroma, slightly lemony and earthy. Tart, heavy grapefruit juice sourness, spritzy elderflower flavour.

Bottle split three ways, bottle from 2014. Light hazy golden pour with tiny lacings on top. Loads of elderflower and lemon juice on the nose. Taste has loads of juiciness from the elderflowers, some light bitterness, light smooth tartness. So incredibly good!

75 cl bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled June 15, 2010. Big thanks to Travlr for trading this to me! First beer of 2015. Clear golden orange on the initial pour with off-white head. Hazier on subsequent pours. Aromas of flowery and floral notes, light funk, herbal notes. Tastes of flowers, floral notes, funk, hay, tart citrus. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Les arômes sont bien acidulés. On perçoit de lorange et des épices. En bouche, les lambics sortent immédiatement suivis des saveurs tropicales de citron et orange. Lamertume est acide et amère.

750 ml bottle. Bottled on 15/June/2010. From a trade with Erzengel. Thank you so much Gabriel!
Cloudy orange golden colour with a big fluffy off-white head. 
Very strong aroma of flowers, pickles, almost chili kind of spiciness, woody dryness and some funkiness. The flavour is sourness, musty and woody notes, tartness and elderflower. Nice and not typical lambic.
2012 bottle pours murky orange yellow with thin head and lacing. Aromas of Brett, pickles, spicy flower. Taste is medium bitter and tart. Tasty.

Bottle, 2012. Pours very hazy orange, small off white head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is funky, Brett, floral, a bit of pickle. Flavor is dry, light tart, medium cantillon funk, dust, flowers, pickles. Medium body, light, effervescent carbonation.
Aroma: Elderberry perfume.Overall: Complex, fresh, leather, burnt asphalt, stable.Note: Bottle 750 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2014-12-27.
Lovely aroma, really fresh elderflower. Hazy gold beer with thin white head. Really good lovely flavours, quite tart on finish, good beer. Very fresh and refreshing. Excellent.

Cor dourada, turva, com baixa formação de espuma e média persistência. Aroma cítrico, ácido, melão no fim. Sabor ácido equilibrado, de casca de frutas cítricas, limão cravo. Final seco e refrescante. Espetacular!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle. Finally trying this. It is much different that msot of the other cantillons, it has a pckled bitter melon character and a very prickling citrus carbonation character, very dry and floral, really tasty.

Big bottle. 2010 vintage. Thanks to KyotoLefty. Yeasty nose, with good funk, and unusual bitter pepper notes, and the flowers brushing by near the end. Hazy medium straw color. Sour lightlly tangy citrus, chopped green chiles, a bit harsh but fun, and thin smokiness. Astringent and a bit acidic. Very intersting nose. The pepper notes were unexpected and added a freshness to the whole. A special brew.

Pours a hazy gold from the bottle with bubbly white head that lasts to leave light lace. Aroma is spearmint, I guess elderflower, big freshness, like what you would think an organic lambic would be. Taste is big fresh spruce, grass, floral, spearmint, amazing, sour funky must on the back end. Odd, but amazing.

Bottle. Golden orange color, almost no head. Aroma of flowers and grass, very nice. Taste is modestly sour and tardy, just the right balance. Notes of elderflower, herbs, horseblanket, berries and a nice bittersweetness. Very good.
Amazing elderflower aroma. Tart horseblanket. By far not as sour as theis other beers. Still amazing taste.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

750ml bottle from beermerchants.com. Bronze amber colour, foam white head and aroma of elderflower, lemon rind citrus, funky yeast. Flavour is tangy, citrus rind, elderflower, woody, barnyard, hay, herbal notes, sour. Smooth slightly oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying sour finish. Very drinkable.
Bottle at Craigs...aroma is vinegar lactic socks...earthy earwax astringent palate...marmalade funk

Cloudy darkened golden, decent scoop of a white head. Odd green apple chewing gum - cooling and tart with a fading sweetness throughout. Doughy batter. Sifting carbonation throughout. Nice smack of floral sweetness towards the finish. Should have had more time with this. Bottle, ScoIrl tasting
Bottle at Craigs. Cheers BenH! Pours hazy yellow with a thin white head. Aromas of elderflower, sour, vinegar. Taste is chalky sour, elderflower, very nice.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy pale amber, nose is floral, sweet toffee, light funk, taste is quite sour, dry, refreshing, floral.
bottle at home ... hazy amber ... soft funk ... dry bready funk fruit ... tart funk .. sharp fruits .. musty fruit ... wierd and funky...

Tasted as Cantillon Zwanze 2009 at an open house day of the brewery. Loose, cream white, thin head, deep orange colour with somewhat reddish hue. Complex aroma, unripe plums, lemon, redcurrant, hay, apple peel, sulphur, sweat, all adorned by an elegant, strong elderberry floweriness. Softer and less acidic than usual for a Cantillon, very complex though, very estery, in which the lambic complexity is cleverly interwoven with a spicy, ethereal, aromatic elderblossom taste. Better than that 2008 rhubarb version.

75CL Bottle from the Bierkoning
Aroma is sweet, oak, funk. Colour between lemon and blonde. Taste oak, mildy acid. A mere hind of elderflower. Basically classic Cantillon. Really not bad, but far from the best I have had.

Sample of both 2013 and 2012 bottles at (Hopp)Kurtkeller 016: Cantillon-tastic 01 on 10/11/2014. Hazy orange-gold color with a medium foamy white head that diminishes steadily to a film. Short strings of lacing. Funky fruit and floral yeast in the nose. Light-bodied with a nice barnyard character and flavors of herbal yeast and lemons. The finish is funky with a citrusy aftertaste. Very good beer all around.

2013 bottle. Clear yellow pour with lots of white frothy head. Aroma is very funky, lots of citrus, subtle sweetness, very dusty, fantastic aroma. Taste is bitter up front, followed by citrus, some floral, with spice towards the end, finish is tart and bitter but not bone dry, mouthfeel and carbonation are medium. Not sure now to describe this other than to say its unique and very tasty, I really liked it but I can see how some people might not.
Bottle 14 - pours light amber. Nice floral notes and barnyard funk in the nose. Tart, lemon zest, and acidic taste. Nicely balance.

Bottle. 2011 brew/2013 bottling.

A: Pumpkin orange color with a white head. No real lacing of which to speak.

N: Elderflower, lemon, pink grapefruit, cedar bark, grain, pine, loam, funk, apple cider vinegar, bubble gum, lavender, and maybe chamomile...maybe.

N: Very sour. Not many other taste descriptors, because my god is this sour.

M: Foamy light body, prickly carbonation, no alcohol presence.

O: This beer is incredibly unique, though I remember thinking that Cable Car had a lot in common with it way back when. Recommended, but dont be surprised if the elderflowers put you off.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 750ml bottle served in a flute glass.
Bottled in March, 2012.
A: Pours a yellow to orange cloudy color forming a big bubbled and aired white to yellow head. Good retention and many lacings left around. Interesting enough is the fact that you can see some pollen floating around inside the bottle
S: A mix of flowers and Lambic. Sour and, at the same time, delicate. The perfume of elderberry flower is really fantastic. Unique and perfect
T: Again, a flower bomb. Strong notes of elderberry flowers followed by malts and Lambic yeasts. Slightly sweet and sour upfront followed by a mild bitterness in the end which I suppose comes from the flowers too. In overall, a dry taste. Perfect in the mouth too
M: Light body and medium carbonation. Flowery aftertaste
O: Very drinkable. A unique experience. One of the best Cantillon Ive ever had
[ BA Review @ 3/9/2013 ]
Bottle. Hazy amber pour with a thick, fuzzy off-white head. Aroma of malt, florals and sour fruit. Tart flavor with some bitter florals before a sour finish.

I was not a fan of this until this years Zwanze Day, but this keg was amazing. The floral character was extremely pleasant rather than overly herbaceous, and this is definitely a lactic beauty, not overwhelmingly sour but great tartness.
2013, thanks Bryan. Tart, slight sour. Some floral bitter hops. Wine and vinegar. Similar to iris and cuvée.

750ml bottle shared with rob at cantillon. poured a hazy brown with thin bubbly head. aroma is of musty yeast and slightly floral. smells like the brewery! nice dry, yeasty, sour taste and quite earthy. tongue tingler. nice.

"A nice sour from Cantillon. 2009 bottle. Funky barnyard, lemons, and some floral qualities to the aroma. Flavor is sour, not quite bracingly so, but not subtle either. There is little sweetness, but an underlying pleasant fruitiness, with hints at bitterness and stinky cheese. Good stuff."
Pours a cloudy brown with little head. Aroma is fruit, citrus, yeast and sour. Taste is fruity and sour. Very good.
On tap at Zwanze day. Comes a hazy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of floral, funk, and fruit. Taste is floral, citrus, funk, spice, and wood. Delicious.
Draft. Pour is hazy orange, minimal head. Earthy, dank, and floral on the nose. Taste is tart and floral, with the elderberries just adding a unique tinge to the palette. Very nice lambic.
Tap at Scheras Zwanze day. Pours gold with minimal head. Smells of floral and barnyard funk. Taste of spice and sour pucker. Solid beer...would like to try again.

Been somewhat of a whale to me. Been wanting this for a hell of a long time. Usually you get disapointed when having big expectations like that. This one did not disapoint. A beer that has everything. The tarty barnyard stableboy combined with the complex yet balanced taste of the elderflower. Try masterpiece from cantillon

Beautiful hazy cobber with dense white head. Aroma is loads of elder flower and stinging netle. Fruity and sour palate. Aftertaste is nestle, fruit, funk and dry stinging netle. Overall: a real wow beer!

Tap @ Zwanze 2014 Grimstad. Cloudy pale orange white small head. Spiced aroma with floral hints. Tart, sweaty. Taste is spiced with star-anise, fennel and citrus. Dry and zezty. 
Medium co2.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 On tap at Erzbierschof for Zwanze Day 2014. Hazy orange color with medium head. Elderflower, elderflower, more elderflower in the aroma. The elderflower dominates, but there?s a bit of tart balance noticeable, less than for other fruit lambics though. Taste is more complex than expected - mostly changes back and forth between tartness and elderflowers. Not too complex finish.Bottle at Moeder Lambic, February 2015. Incredible stuff. More character than I remembered from tap, perfect balance, a very tempting experience.
Fresh 2016 bottle at Zwanze 16. Hazy orange color with white head. Very sticky elderflower, spicy, citrus, flowery. Taste is spicy, elderflower, slightly earthy. Medium carbonation. Very good, great balance, slightly bitter hoppy finish. So creamy and tempting!

750ml bottle, just over a year old. Pours out clear golden with a white head. Aroma is strangely vegetal at first, then opens up with lemon, floral notes, melon rind and leather. Lots going on beyond elderflower it would seem. Taste feels almost as complex, and elderflower is more prominent. Really well poised mouthfeel. Body is particularly robust and sourness is dialled in just right. On this evidence Id say that Mamouche definitely doesnt deserve to be the forgotten beer in Cantillons line up.

Oh how wonderfull this was. Poured light orange with minimal head. Aroma of lemon tartness and such a great herbal character which made this unique and fantastic. Such a wondeful flavor of funk yeast butter and tart dry finish. A++++
Shared bottle. Poured a dark golden yellow colour with a Nice small white head. Strong aroma of elderflowers, yeast, Lemons, barnyard, oak, floral, Nice sour aftertaste, loved it!
Oro leggea schiuma non molto persistente lievi note fruttate legno leggero erbace floreale buona acidita ma abbastanza smussata
An amazing dance of the herbal sweet delicacy of the elderberry as it rushes up to meet your nose balanced atop Cantillons acidic, tart, lip puckering, effervescent wheaty and grainy Lambic.
0,33l on tap @ Pikkulintu. Pours hazy golden with a low head. Aroma is sour malts. Flavor is sour malts with some floral fruits. Excellent stuff.
Tap at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is cloudy orange with very small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, tartness, sourness, floral and tackiness.

Bottle. Cloudy amber pour with a small foamy ring of head. Aroma are rotten flowers, lemon candy, and some barnyard. Tastes moderate to strong sourness. Dry rotten flowers. Tons of barnyard and cheese. Hints of citrus. Not terrible but not something Id go back to again.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2015 Bottle: Super hazy, burnt yellow body with a white-ish head that fades quickly to a thin, albeit lasting collar. Aroma has that lovely, signature Cantillon critter funk. Mild lactic acidity, funky barnyard, some sweat sock funk, dry wood, light floral & botanical notes, a small hint of yogurt, & a bit of citrus spritz. Taste has lots of soft woodiness, critter funk with a touch of barnyard & sweaty horse funk. Nice lemon sourness, very mild acidity that snaps but doesnt burn, citrus, & moderate jock strap funk. A touch of mildly herbal & floral notes coming through the funk every now & then. Dry, woody finish with tons of that lingering funk.

Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate funky, cheese, feet, and lemon. It pours a hazy golden-orange with a one finger white head that quickly fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of citrus. The finish has light-moderate cork, light sour lemon, lemon peel, floral notes, and a touch of oak. Its light bodied with light carbonation. Overall, it smells a lot better than it tastes.

Bottle @ Cantillon Brewery. Pours dark yellow with a white head, some nice lacings. Aroma is sour, yeasty, dusty, leather, barnyard, nice sweet elderflowers, notes of lemonzest. Just great and very inviting. Flavor is sourness, yeast/brett, barnyeard, grapes, leather, dust, sweet elderflowers, lemonzest. Medium body, average carbonation, lasting sour finish. Just a very great beer.290714
Tap. Pours orange with white head. Aroma is very floral, dry, tart. Wild yeasts. Has a very extreme floral flavor, lots going on. Dry but good fruitiness to balance it out. Exceptional.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2015 Draft at a sour event at Monks Cafe in August 2014. Cloudy gold pour with a foamy ring. Very tart and very dry. Elderflower. Bee Pollen. Sickel pear. Fresh oak. Sage. Juniper. Straw. Goldenrod. Distinctive floral notes. Bitter and astringent. Tremendous! UPDATE: Having it for the first time in a bottle in October 2015 (again at Monks). Crystal clear gold pour. More refined now. More complex. More restrained. Sits quietly at first but the wonderful dusty wildness returns in the finish. Tremendous!
Hazy yellow with a low white head. Funky yeast, grass, fruit and sour aromas. The taste was floral, light fruits, funk and lambic sour ending in a big elderflower juice notes. Just great!
Pours golden. Random notes at this point, sorry... very round finish. Very austere, funky but not acrid. Interesting. Definition of a sipper.

(#1100) Bottle at Cantillon and on tap at Akkurat. Pours hazy golden with a frothy white head. The bottle was fresh (2 days since bottling) and had lots of elder flower in the aroma, nice funky, tart, floral, hay, earth in the background. Taste is light fruity and floral sweetness up front, the acidity takes over in the end leading to a dry tart refreshing finish. Light/medium bodied.

Bottle as Zwanze 2009 at Moeder Fontainas. Pours a dark blond with a thick one inch lasting white head. Highly aromatic: floral, fruity and barnyard. The green pepper signature is also present and blends nicely with fruitiness. Taste is moderate lactic sourness with a strong floral presence. It is considerably smoother than fresh Mamouche. Awesome, impressive balance.
Bottle - Vintage 2913 - Herbal and funky feet. Cloudy yellow with a good white head. Tartness up front, citric acid and funky herbal feet.
Great tart dry aroma. Feet or dirty underwear. Hiking shorts, fungal foot growth and dry, white pepper. Very tasty.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 Bottle at home with friends, courtesy of Armin. Thanks man! Decanted this one for around a half hour and It seemed to make a big difference. Pour is slightly hazy lemon peel with a small white head and good lacing. Fresh grassy aroma - resin, lemon peels, lactic, lavender, flower petals, biscuit, and honey in the aroma. Taste is grassy, funky, lemon, urine, horse blanket, raw fruits, biscuit, and lactic sourness with some heavy tartness on the backend. Light body with medium carbonation. Semi-bitter towards the end and definitely different, but cool.

Bottle 750 ml at home, poured into a teku glass. ABV 5%
Beautiful golden colour on the body, clear, sunny and bright, with a small white head on top, with good retention, leaving minimal lacing on the glass. 
Aroma is flowery with elder flower notes, peach, light vinegar.
Taste also of flowers with peaches, light acidic, wood, grape notes. Very good.
Medium thin body, low carbonation, tart palate.
The best Cantillon I had till now.

Bottle. Poured a dark, hazy yellow, with a dense white head. Aroma of apples, elderflower and lactic acids. Flavours of assertive tart fruit, more elderflower and earthy notes. Finish was well balanced sweet/ sour fruit, cooked fruits and brown sugar.

Bottled. Pours clear, deep golden with a small,lacing, white head. Aroma of elder flowers, barnyard and wood. Sweet flavor that ends up dru and more sour. Medium bodied, watery texture and soft carb. An excellent sour.

Tap at hops and pie. Hazy yellow gold with a tiny white head. Aromas of tart fruit, hot peppers, pickle juice, and light vinegar. Flavor is tart citrus, pickle juice, hot peppers, light vinegar and funk. Light to medium bodied.

Une soupe hyper florale qui sacidifie rapidement au fond de la gorge. Chaque gorgée nous amène vers un cohérence vraiment impressionnante. Je suis pas mal surpris, jétais pas convaincu avec les fleurs de sureau.

Bottle through trade label reads bottled june 15 2010. Pour has a golden color with a fizzy one finger head that retained a cap very well. Aroma has herbs, elder flower, green pepper, and oak. Mouth feel is average and there is good steady carbonation. Flavor has a fair amount of acidity, green pepper, pickle juice, elder flowers, peppercorn, and a lasting woody finish. Bit more pepper heat than I care for.

Bottle @ The brewery and tap @ Moeder. I love the elderflowers which when had fresh blossom like an angel. Although when aged a little the flowery flavors turn into musty green peppers in a somewhat disturbing way. Wonderful aroma that remind us Northerners of our childhood memories of drinking elderflower juice.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2014 June 26, 2013 corked and capped 750 ml bottle from Tipples. Pours hazy golden almost tangerine color with a half finger of white fizzy head that quickly recedes. Aroma...well this is interesting. Peaches, vinegar, floral notes, light dry oak and sourness, and yes, dill pickles. Somehow not off-putting though and the sweet peachy smell is nice. Flavor is pickle juice, sour vinegar funk, dry oak, light peaches or apricots. Weird. Light bodied but sweet with prickly high carbonation. Finishes dry. This is unique to say the least.

75cl bottle (vintage?) shared @NachtvdGroteDorst 2014 - takk til Johann och hans svenska provsmakningsgruppen! A blanket of elderflowers and a spring meadow radiant with dandelions covers an elegant world of suave and subdued sours, on a spectacular tart lemon zest biscuit malt base. Pickled grapefruit candy. Twofaced in another way than the dryhopped like St.Gilloise, first bringing to mind elderflower saisons like Cazeau before deleting that impression and taking it an earthy and sour step further like only character-headstrong Cantillon can.

Bottle in The Wharf, Macclesfield. Snowy had the wedge and delivered. Cloudy yellow gold with a quickly fading head. Aroma is quite subtle but damn fine, lemon, grapefruit, some floral stuff. Flavour is similar with loads of elderflower, mouthfeel excellent, finish brilliant. Yeah, loved this. Good night, good pub, decent crowd out, a real stand out beer.

2011 vintage - poured straight into my tumbler. Fresh elderflower- powdery dry froth. Huge pepper presence on the palate. Wow, this is a spicy meatball. The spice and pepperiness detract from the flavor big time, unfortunately. Overall its muddled and Id lean towards calling it a spice bomb.

**After trying additional examples and taking the advice of Bill Y, decanting this beer gives it a huge increase in palatability. After pouring into a decanter and letting sit for 30-40 minutes a lot of the harsh peppery spice notes are muted and you can taste the elderflower on its own. Still a very unique example of what plant additives can do to lambic. Perhaps my least favorite Cantillon from the standard lineup, though an interesting curiosity to revisit sparingly.

Bottle shared at DLD. Pours a clearish piss yellow with a slight white head. Aroma of sour apples, floral earthy aroma as well. Taste is slightly sour but well balanced. Really enjoyable, glad to try this one.

750 ml bottle. Pours a clear gold with full head that settles quickly. Aromas of green apples, elderberries, brett/body odor, and wild flowers. Vinous, light floral flavors with fruity lime and gooseberry notes. Still a beer? I dont know, but its delicious.
Glowing hazy pearlescent orange, with a lasting head. Big floral earty tart scents. A full mouth feel on the sip. Floral tart sour earthy grape skin flavors.

Bottle in Brussels at Café des Spores. Pours a yellowy amber with small white head. Aroma is that oddly vegetal Mamouche quality: big bell pepper, flowers, stone fruit, caramel, light lemon but not especially acidic. Taste is apricot, basil, and elderflower, with grapefruit zest and light bitterness on the finish. Soft acidity. Grapefruit-pith bitterness grows with each sip. Light and smooth mouthfeel. Quite good.

Bottleshare thanks to homer321. Moderately tart nose with a laundry detergent kinda smell. Taste is flowery with moderately peppery phenolics. Taste is nowhere nearly as tart as the nose indicated. Some peppery spicey warming. Very drinkable and enjoyable.

Bottle share thanks to Homer321. Pours a hazy orange color with white head. Initial typical Cantillon funky yeast aroma, citrusy character and light spicy pepper phenols. Funky yeast yumm flavor, tart, sour, followed by the pepper spicy notes. Very tasty.
Bottle share thanks to Homer. Pours golden. Aroma of tartness, yeast, sour, lemon. Taste is light, tart, citrusy, a bit spicey. Pretty yummy.
On draft at Maxs, pours a clear yellow with low head, aroma is funky sawdust and floral. Taste is light funk and light tart flowers, very nice

750 ml bottle. Almost clear golden body with a small off-white head. Lovely, funky aroma with some fresh grass, lemon, flowers and some wood. Flavor is quite acidic, lemon, flowers, light spicy and moderate funky. Not as complex as a good Geuze, but distinct, almost raw lambic heavy spiced with flowers. Medium to light body and acidic in aftertaste. Sure refreshing and interesting but probably not my everyday beer (if it was available).
750ml bottle pours a golden yellow with an off white head. Floral citrus and oak aroma. Taste is the same with a bit of a tart apple.

Hand drawn at Backcountry on Sour Sunday. Pours hazy orange with very small white head, settles in seconds with no lace. Aroma is very funky and floral, huge elderflower, oaky and mildly tart. Flavor is funky, moderately tart up front with a big floral, buttery oak, tart, mildly vinous finish. Pleasant and tasty. Very soft carbonation, light body, juicy texture, and mildly astringent finish.

Sample at En Öl- och Whiskymässa, Gothenburg. Pours hazy yellow with a smal tan white head, quickly disappearing. No real lacings. Aroma is a lovely mix of citrus, hay, barn, yeast and some fresh flowers. Taste is initially citrus, light vinegar tone, elder flower, yeast and becomes slightly bitter and rough with notes of herbs in the finish along with a lingering tartness in the background. Full body, medium carbo. Very nice!

At big Seths going away party on 11/2/2013; was an awesome day! Aroma is dirt, massive hay note, big bell pepper, grass, cucumber, very interesting. Taste is nice gueuze tartness, big cucumber, vegetable, celery, very light acidity.

Cloudy beige. Thin head. The aroma is full of elderflower, light sugar, and barrelly Cantillon. Hugely spicy and woody, subtle elderflower that grows stronger through the woody, austere finish. Quite a bit more bitterness than Im accustomed to in a lambic. The underlying lambic seems softer and sweeter than most Cantillons. Tartness mainly shows at the end, which is basically the funkiest part of the beer. Great innovation. This really gets to the roots of beverage-making: take alcohol, steep with flavouring. The result, if lambic is one step from modern beer, is something that is two steps from it.

Hazy orange with a small pale head. Aroma is grains of paradise, wildflowers, spicy peppers. Spicy on the palate, with a balanced background of light sweetness and sourness, hint of herbal bitterness on the aftertaste. Taste is herbal tea, peppercorns, pickled peppers, lemon rind. Interesting

Bottle at 3 Sma Rum, Gothenburg. Poured a hazy medium to light amber with a round white head. The aroma is citrus yeast light vinegar. The flavour is medium sour with a smooth wild yeast citrus palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. I feel honoured to be drinking this small piece of Belgium here in Sweden! Amazing. Now Im thinking about food pairings. Perhaps I should stop thinking and just finish this bottle!

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of sourness, funkiness, some floral and earthy notes, light oaky notes, and some pale malts. Flavor the same with a great blend of everything. Average texture. Another great Cantillon beer.

(bottle - 750 ml - 2013 vintage) Cloudy yellow pour. Sour and salty tart and funk aroma. Flavor is the same. Sour and slightly sweet up front but the finish has a bit of salt and vinegar pickle hints at the end of it. So sour and funky throughout. And the salty finish at the end really enhanced it for me. Loved it.

Bottle. hazy with a low white head. Funky yeast, grass, fruit and sour aromas. The taste to me was a mash up of floral, light fruits, funk and lambic sour that ended up tasting like pickles to me. I like pickles so it wasnt too bad.

A- pours a hazy apricot orange with a weak light orange head. Very minor lacing. 

S- musty wood, celery, citrus blossoms, wet feet, grass, lemon zest, apple orchard, autumn squash, faint latex.

M- light acidic and tart palate with a light watery and sticky body. 

T- lemon, grapefruit, squash to start. Middle is dusty, citrus, celery (light vegetal), light coriander and lemon pepper spice. Ending is zinc, bitter orange pulp, grass that lingers in the back of the throat. 4.0

De vlierbloesem brengt een bloemige toets in de fruitge aromas. Vochtig hout, appel voeren de boventoon in een rijpe, evenwichtige geur, die zich voortzet in de zachte smaak van een twee jaar oude lambiek.

On tap @ La Capsule, Lille - FR. Color: nice golden blond beer with no carbonation and no head. Smell: sour fruity notes with spices presence. Taste: nice sour taste with fruity notes and citrus. Aftertaste: sour, and wet sensation.

2013 btl. Looks..yellow amber, small head. Smells..citrus acidic, bretty and grassy floral scents from elderflower. Tastes..good dose of lemon/citrus sourness, the elderflower is soft, but strong enough to provide a great balance to the sour/funk. Refreshing cantillon greatness.

Bottle from Mane Liquor Institution of Tobacco Rolling and Coffee Grinding. Many thanks to nbird for sharing his June 2013 bottle. Pours peachy gold with a pillowy head and thick lacing. Upfront aroma of zest, lemongrass, sherbet, flower bouqets and brett. Upfront taste is dry lemon, hay, lactic sourness is kept in check by the fresh flower flavours. Mouth feel is creamy but still fairly lively. Nice dry finish, lingers on the palate. Age keeps the sour at bay and the flower notes very fresh, stellar drop as usual from Cantillon.

06/2013 bottle.Pours a hazy golden, minimal head, fine lacing, nice, bubbly carbonation. Smells of green peppers, straw, fresh cut flowers and a light bready yeast. Tastes of green peppers, must, lacto sourness, bread and flowers. Very nice balance. Crisp, dry finish. Interesting and my kind of weird.

Se fossi una donna non vorrei che mi regalassero mazzi di fiori, mi basterebbe il profumo di questa birra elegante e superba. Aroma intenso di fiori che cattura e suduce. Gusto ugualmente floreale, con preminenza del sambuco, che pervade il palato grazie alla penetrazione dellacido sublime e senza sbavature. La Mamouche incarna lo spirito del bacio di Proserpina che fu capace di struggere il cuore del dio degli Inferi. Come potremmo noi mortali resistere?
Strong flowery aroma, a bit overpowering. Taste has a nice depth with moderate lactic sourness.

Mamouche is a bit more accessible than many Catillon offerings. It is also has more funk than most Cantillon beer. There is a balance between sourness, funk expression, bitterness and a bit of yeast. A Broad range of flavors develop a fair degree of complexity although the expression of elderflower is limited and seems to contribute more of a slightly bitter herbal character than any floral character. This beer evolves through the glass so small pours may deprive one of the full experience.

Aroma: Citrus, Hay, Mild Lactic Acid

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Hay, Lemons, Orange Peels

Mouthfeel. Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Bitter
Bottle. Golden with white head. Aroma is very musty with flowers, parma violets, elderflower. Taste is very floral, musty, funky, parma violets, elderflower. Dry and tart. Excellent.

Golden colour with a white and quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is very floral, notes of green apples and citrus. Flavor has decent acidic mouthfeel with a high presence of citrus notes and wooden hints. The final has a decent acidic sensation with citrus and floral notes.

Thanks to Morgan and Cena from Sweden for sharing the last bottle at the Cantillon Brewery this year. 

Vintage 2010

A: Golden on straw ale with excellent clarity. Two fingers of bone white foam falls to a quilt of the same, which stays for the life of the beer. Central column of continuous bubbles. Spotty lacing.

S: Whoa, I could smell this as soon at it was corked! The Elderberry Blossoms are potent! I have never had this flower in my face, so I cant compare, my table mates said it was totally obvious (Cena didnt know it was brewed with the flower and called it out immediately). To me: peppercorns, soil, black tea, cilantro and a hint of mint. Cant get my nose out of the glass, its embarrassing given my new company wants to chat.

T: Initially soil forward, peppery, herbal. I honestly am having a difficult time describing this beer. Its something I would pair with oysters on the half-shell alongside some enanthaler and chilled white grapes. There, that clears it up right? 

M: Thin bodied with prickly carbonation. Good dry finish. Truly this is like a sparkling wine.

O: This beer is excellent, complex, fun and intriguing. I wish there was some to buy from the brewery because its amazing!

Serving type: bottle

06-21-2011
Notes from backlog. High in sourness, but not too much, the balance is very good. Floral notes, grapes, lemons.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2016 Rerate 161108
Hazy golden with low white head 
Aromas of green apples, elderberries, cracked garden branch 
Taste has cracked garden branch, elderberries, gooseberry, tart ripe apples , garden leaves, hints of earth 
Brilliant!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours murky golden orange with minimal white head. Aroma of green apples, hay, gooseberries, elderflower, basement. Taste is tart, bretta, grape sour with balanced sweet finish. Body is light and crisp with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours apricot with no head. Aroma is honey, sour peach, gooseberry, kiwi. Taste is honey, peach, gooseberry, kiwi, sour cherries.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours slight hazy blond, small white head.

Smell floral and perfumy. Sweet and oily.

Taste spices, floral and herby, bit of a tart aftertaste

Lighter body

Very unique, decent but not something you want a lot of.

Drunk from 75cl bottle bought direct from brewery. Elderflower added to the lambic. Sharp but full of flavour.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottled, xmas 2012 tasting chez baerwaldt, big thanks chris. poured a faintly hazed golden orange; aroma of gooseberry, green grapefruit and, yes, elderflower; typical green olive brine flavours with some sherbet sweetness - intense yet mellow. fantastic
Hazy golden color with white head. Nice peppery aroma, also floral and sour. At taste is sour with a very strong peppery flavour.

[18-OCT-2013] Draught at EurHop Beer Festival (EBF) 2013 in Rome. Pours orange to yellow with a nice head, aroma is spiced with pepper and chilli like, lively and sour, flavor is a bit spicy with peppers, brett and vinegar, almost full bodied, nice

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2014 75cl bottle, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: funky, little fruity, sour, horse blanket.
TASTE: funky, horse blanket, sour, the flowers are not really prominent in this batch... (batch 2013)
Drank again as Zwanze 2009 in Moeder Lambic Updated the score, since this aged sample was a lot better! The flowery taste is still very alive in the beer after being 5 years old. Very nice!

On the train from Hereford to Inverness, bottle acquired from the brewery , 18/10/13.
Hazed orange with a good sized off white head that thins to a pond like covering.
Nose carries light floral notes, perfumed, peaches, damp straw, elderflower, barnyard.
Taste comprises dank straw, tarte peach, elderflower, mildly acidic waft, floral, lemon rind, grass.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dank straw notes in the finale.
Another great Fruit Lambic form Cantillon.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 750, corked and capped. Pours a hazy pale gold with a loose fizzy white head. Bright barnyardy nose with stone fruit showing. Crisp light fizzy body. Tart tangy stone fruit mid palate. Long tart finish. Wonderfully sharp and minerally and dry.

18/10/2013 Eurhop (tap). Dorata, torbida, schiuma bianca abbondante e persistente. Aroma straordinario, stalla, cantina, note floreali e balsamiche, agrumate e pungenti. In bocca è spettacolare, acido stemperato dalle note floreali e balsamiche, grande complessità ed eleganza (cosa abbastanza rara in cantillon!). Corpo medio-leggero, carbonazione media. Un capolavoro.

Draft. Lemon sour nose, foggy yellow, weird grassy nutty finish, not much complexity, very long finish, tart taste. A whole lot of talk about this beer but it was not my favorite at the Trappist Rare Sour Beer Fest

75cl bottle. Hazy orange with small head. Nose : green apple, tart, gooseberry, zest, wood. Sip : oily texture, low carbonation. Medium body. Fruity citrus and gooseberry or rhubarb like flavor. Dry with notes of apple seeds, zest. Its well balanced and not overpowering like usually lambics do. It has a different dimension, more like wild fruits, herbs.

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Hazy orange whitish head. Some nettles, wild grass, light barnyard notes in aroma. Sour fruityness, slightly burning nettles in taste. Feels a bit different compared to other Cantillons Ive tried before with the light burning of nettles being the biggest difference. Almost some vegetable notes at sometime, which fortunately evens out towards the finish. Quite easy to drink however.
2011. Unclear copper of color with a white head. An aroma of horseback, sour, dusty, weak elderberry flower and dry. A flavor of wood, elderberryflower, flowers, sour, vegetables and dry.
