Tap @ Akkurat. Hazy orange, thick white head. Floral, elder aroma, later mostnoticeable in the aroma. Spicy, refreshing, light sour. Flavor has elder, sourness, wheat, rhubarb. Incredibly refreshing. Long lasting finish, dry.-- via beerbasher/winphone 7

Tap. Hazy "lambic" color with white head. Aroma: classic cantillon funk blended with a nice elder aroma. Tadty has a nice classic cantillon taste with some elder in it. Nice lambic that gets better when arming up

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2013 From a shared bottle at the brewery. Hazy gold pour with a small white head. Very interesting aroma that reminds of a Belgian ale: floral aromatics. Sour flavor that I swear had pickles about midway through. Interesting. If this warms up, you start getting straight yellow grapefruit juice...consider yourself warned.
Pours brighter than I expected, orange almost. Aromas were restrained but classic sour/floral. Taste was evolving sour character with straw, green grass and chamomile. Approachable and moreish lambic

Amazing light smoky smell. This ones a little more sour and tangy than the other Cantillons. Not sure exactly what it is, but something kind of smokey here. I thought I knew how to rate beer before I had all these Cantillons today. Finishes a light sourness but kind of crisp, instant sour. Bottle at Volo for Zwanze Day.
Bottle. Color orange with large not lasting white head. Aroma floral, wood, barnyard. Taste acid, sweet, floral.

Beautiful appearance, orange dark orange color with a good tanned head. Good retention.
Really surprising in nose and mouth. The traditional lambic notes, with some wood, tart, lemon and something strange(I assume that from the elderflowers..).
Its a good one, curious with this flowers point.

Tengo que decir, que no es mi estilo pero que cada vez me gustan más las lámbicas. Esta, con flores de saúco, es bastante especial. Envejecida en barrica de roble. De color naranja, precioso, ligeramente turbia. Abundante espuma. Olor claramente a lámbica pero no tan ácido. En boca, lo mismo...se nota que es de fermentación espontánea pero algo más compleja. Se nota el envejecimiento y supongo que será las flores de saúco.
Bottle ..Pour is yellow with a thin white head..Nose is floral, perfume, tart, spices, lemon..Taste is floral, spices, lemon, banana pepper, light funk..

750 ml capped and corked bottle, bottled on 07 June 2012. Served in a Unibroue tulip, the beer pours golden/orange with about an inch off-white head that didnt stay around for very long. Theres a decent amount of lacing. Aroma is nice and tart, the brew smells like tart lemon, herbs/flowers (which I assume is from the elderflowers), oak, and some funk. It tastes like tart citrus, elderflowers (herbal/floral taste), green pepper, funk, oak, and some apricot. Mouthfeel/body is light, its well carbonated and enjoyable to drink. I thought this was a good brew, Id like to pick up another bottle at some point. Bottle from Etre Gourmet.

Bottle at home in London - shared with the missus on Sunday evening. Pours lightly hazy gold with a zippy, fleeting white cream head. The aroma holds crispy grass and ripe green pepper. Light sweet flavor with well-rounded funk, modest sourness that meshes well with the lightly bitter, lightly spicy and floral elderflower. Light bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Light grassy bitterness to finish, some sweat, green pepper, mild salty tartness, hints of lemon rind. Lovely stuff. While its classic Cantillon with the grassy tang, the elderflower character really sets this beer apart from the rest of the Cantillon line-up. Wonderful.

Bottle @ a recent bottle share... Poured clear, golden with a thin head. This was an odd one for sure. Some sips were good, some were awkward and astringent. Certainly a green bell pepper note in the aroma and flavor. Mixed with a tart, pickled relish note and herbal spices. Some light fruits, tartness and funky yeast notes too.

Bottle from mane liquor. pours a light bright yellow with a bubbly white head. Aroma is lemony, some spiciness and some tart funkness. A lot going in the taste, sour lemon upfront with some tropical and spicy notes as well. Has a lively carbonation which added to it. Fantastic beer.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Aged in cellar for about 2 years. Pours clear yellow with a very sticky white head leaving great lacing and amazing retention. Nose shows heavy lemon and light floral notes with shortbread, spice and heavy funk. Smells like its going to be pretty funky and sour. Didnt disappoint. Great sourness to this one. Very complex. Floral notes, apricot, lemon, bread, lemon cake, tropical juice, earthy. Wow. Could drink the whole bottle myself if I wanted too. Perfect beer

Bottle opened night before euro trip.Golden orange hazy pour with some white head. Citrus, and light orange aromas with some bell pepper like spices. Flavor is light tartness, bell peppers, but is this cantillon?

Bottle from a trade with Black IPA. Pours clear pale golden color with white head. Floral aroma (elderflower?) with some cucumber and green pepper. Sour flavor with flowers and faint green pepper. Medium body with lively carbonation. Thanks Shawn.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2013 Fläder är tydligt både i doft och smak. Hög syra. Ca 2 år gammal flarra. Världsklass.                  --------                

Färsk flarra (någon månad) i bryssel. Doftar fläder i hela baren när vi häller upp. Underbar doft. Påminner ju en hel del om flädersaften man drack som barn. Good times

Bottle. The pour is is a hazy yellow orange. The aroma is all sour. The taste is a little too carbonated. Also a little spicy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber pour with white head, fresh floral aroma, obvious Elderflower taste with floral slight citrus, reviews are brief a session.

bottle share at hill farmsteads post-3rd anniversary. pours almost clear bright golden with a very nice white head, good retention and lacing. aroma is very complex: flowers, plants - yes, a hint of dill, but its not overpowering and dont seek for pickles here, funk-plenty, ginger, very nice lactic presence complemented by subtle woodsy notes, some pale fruitiness - maybe a hint of apricot and something flowery tropical in there along with white grape must. dusty and yeasty. old fatty and grassy hops. bright carbonation, light body. will re-rate, too bad it was my bottle.. but always glad to share. awesome brew!

75cl bottle.Smell - lemons and elderflowers.  Golden yellow with a small but enduring white head.  Taste - dry and acidic like a cider, balanced with sweetened lemon juice.  Lemon dominates but there are background flavours - floral, under-ripe fruits.  OK.  Refreshing.

Thanks to Tommy! Looking forward to this one so I decided to crack it open after finding out I got promoted! Spicy chive and elderflower aroma. Clear golden yellow. Persistent white head. Floral notes with great balance. Some acidicity. Lemon zest. Unsweetened grapefruit. Elderflower comes through in the finish in the floral notes. Really delicious!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle, bottled 08 June 2012, received in Urbancavers 2013 Dark Lord Day Single Bottle BIF, split with my wife.  Pours a hazy orange-amber color with a thin white head.  Aroma is huge, floral, I can only assume elderflower, vegetal, some lemony citrus, kinda smells like dill pickles.  Medium on the palate with soft, smooth, carbonation.  Flavor is lightly sour, fruity, floral, similar to the aroma, but fruitier, some lemony tartness, with a light, elderflower finish that lingers for a while.  Not my favorite from Cantillon, but a super interesting beer.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2015 Hot damn. Ty MotherBrother. Pours clear yellow with a big white head. Smell is ez elderflower, hops and a slight sourness. Taste is both bitter and sour, and uses the elderflower very well! A little hay, a little grass, and some unripe grapes. A slight sweet orange perhaps? Fizzy, sharp and with a dry finish. Good stuff, but im not that much into elderflower.
Re-rate 2015, 10th of april. Im now a little more into elderflower, and this beer is really nice.

Pour slightly hazy yellow, with a small white fizzy head. Aroma of elderflower, slight tart, slight hay, gooseberries, horse blanket, some woody notes as well. 
The taste is quite sour up front, with a nice amount of bitterness and slight fruity sweetness. A little bit dry when swallowed. Average lambik bodied - and carbonated.
Murky yellow. Nose is funk, tart root vegetables, flowers. Taste is very tart, root vegetables, flowers, funk. One of my favorite fruit lambics.

Bottle, vintage 2010. Hazy orange liquid with medium to big white head. Aroma of lemons, apples, elderberries, barnyard, sweet tropical fruit and wood. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of elderberries, barnyard, lemons and apple skin. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome beer.
This was lovely, possibly the best Cantillon Ihave had. Sour, but reserved, wild but austere, funk but not a punk. Lemony, flowery, perfumey but all the while sour and funky.
Bottle at RBJG 2 Grand Tasting, thanks Travlr. Chuwy was duck. Hazy golden colour with a large white head. No lacing. Sour slightly funky flowery aroma. Flavour is sour, funky, citric, flowery.

RBJG2. Again, big thanks to Travlr as I had only drunk this previously before I started rating. Golden slightly cloudy colour. Aroma is pickles, nice tartness, floral, citrus. Taste is herbal, nice sourness. Great beer again. Kind of surprised what I wrote, but that just gives me a reason to drink it again.

Tastes of nothing but green pepper. I mean sure if you try you can get Elderflowers from that, in the worst way. Its not even sour enough to hide the horrid taste with a blast of funk. Stick to the classic and leave this thing alone. Unless you like green pepper juice. Then guzzle this thing.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 2010 bottle in Nov 2014. Nose of green peppers, some smoke, liked roasted chipotles. Flavors of lemon, leather, chili, smoke, cabbage, lemon. Very strange and original, very fun and delicious. 

Bottle shared by Trvlr, 2013: 7/4/8/4/15 Nose of pickles, cabbage, lemon, acid. Flavors of citrus (mostly lemon), veggies, light yogurt, funk. Very interesting stuff. Rather oily palate. Strange but likeable.
I am rolling down a hill with cantillon lambic in an oak barrel picking dandelions and then eating them. so sour, so lovely. eating dandelions is great. Wow, this rocks.

75cl bottle, 2011 vintage at Torst shared with jrgratz and other RBers.  Pours clearish gold with a thick foamy white head.  Aroma is incredibly floral and herb-like. Its earthy, funky, and yeasty: its like smelling spring in a bottle. Incredible aroma unlike anything else.  Beautiful taste of flowers and herbs and elderberries with perfect acidity and funkiness. I havent tasted a beer with this sort of floral profile before.  Really terrific beer.
Acida e stranamente speziata, una cantillon disgustosa, si salva solamente laroma.

Tasted for the first time at Zwanze Day at the Holy Grale in Louisville.  Pours a hazy peachy golden color with a small white head.  The aroma has some funk, floral notes, herbs, peppery spice, and some dill with light fruity notes as well.  The flavor has an odd combination of dill, florals, peppery spice, mild fruit notes, sour and funk.  I need to revisit this again and update.

Bottle share with Bruce.  Aroma of cellar funk, roses, slight band aid, and tart cranberry.  Pours hazy Orange with nice film and great carbonation.  Taste is wonderful with cellar funk, holly berry, elderberry, and greatness.  I love this!

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2013 Dirty peach colour. Aroma is stone fruit, floral and funk - all well integrated smells to make up an overall picture. Taste is more complex - tart, funk, nice peachy sour flavour, slightly astringent tartness. Palate is sour and dry; great. Overall, another amazing Cantillon fruit lambic. Great fun to drink.

Bottiglia 75cl
Lambic ai fiori di sambuco.
Molto particolare, decisamente buona.
Personalmente al preferisco alla gueuze classica.
Più fruttata e un pò meno cida, si apprezza molto il sambuco.

This Cantillon Mamouche is a really, really odd beer. Its like someone made a salad and crammed it into a Cantillon sour, lots of vegetal and asparagus like character dominates a pretty sour gueze base. I dug on it for a little bit but ultimately couldnt finish my sample.

Bottle generously shared by khoffman43! (Thanks!)  Light yellow pour, a little carbonation and a really odd aroma of dill pcikles.  Although the aroma was off putting, the meld of funky yeast, hay and elderberries actually made this work.  Not the best from Cantillon, but good.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is.intense pickles, super pickles. Flavor is pickles, slight funk and nice pepper/spice. Flavor is way better than the aroma.

bottle shared by Kyle. Pours hazy yellow gold with a soft tight white head that settles to a thin film. Aroma has spice peeper and dill. Taste is funky farmhouse spice little dill pickle and malty yeast. Palate is medium and drying. Nice.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2015 Bottle thanks Kyle! Pickles! Very strong nose - dirty, funky and pickles. Spicy aftertaste grapefruit leads up to this. Very interesting, glad to share a bottle.

2014 bottle shared by Steazy - thanks Ryan!! Much better bottle, funky mild sourness, bumping up my rating.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2014 Bottle - thanks Kyle! Hazy golden pour with a white head. Dill and barnyard funkiness. Quite dry on the finish. Excellent!

Re-rate at Zwanze Day 2014. Getting a hint of pepper heat - just a tiny hint. Awesome.

Man, is that a pickle lambic?! This is what immediatly came to my mind upon the first whiff. It does indeed smell like some lambic infused pickles. Once we get over that it is actually really nice. Taste is medium sour with no sweetness (it ends up quite dry). Flavors once again remind of pickles, with a weird floral/vegetal (literally like dill to me) aftertaste. This is quite an experience, but not an unpleasing one. It is less over the top sour and funky which utimately makes it a lot more drinkable. Not the best Cantillon ever but it is still a "must try" for any lambic lover.

Bottle from utobeer at home. Spicy chive onion aroma. Clear golden yellow. Persistent white . Floral notes great balance. Some acidicity. Lemon zest. Unsweetened grapefruit. Elderflore comes through in the finish in  the floral notes.
Bottle shared by marcus. Aroma is funk and sour. Taste has a weird grass weed flavor. Nice sour lots of funk.

Drunk with Dom and Dan. MAMOUCHE!! Like a spring morning in a meadow in something written by a Bronte. Quietly brilliant. Gently sour that puckers and teases. Theres a thin hop veneer between sup and swallow.
Lovely. Fresh as a spring day. Bish was right, I want to drink this slowly, on a summer day, in the garden, with the children laughing and my feet up. As great as I hoped it would be. Delicious.
Bottle from dommod. Utterly delicious. Sunshiney, fresh, citric, floral, sour, immense. You could drink this all Jaar.

Bottle"3små rum Gothenburg: Hazy yellow colour,flat head. Aroma has a nice mix of fruits, flowersand sournes. Flavor had a werry nice complexity of fruits, flowers,berry,sournes, thin body medium long sour finish, nice!

(75 cl bottle from Toft Vin; Bottled June 7th 2012 - drink before 10 years) Pours a clear golden with little, white head. Some lace and regeneration. Aroma is elderflower and earthy funk. Oily texture, soft carbonation, medium body and tart, floral finish. Taste large follows the nose. Interesting and surprisingly drinkable. Girlfriend says: "It was very elderflowery at first but then it turns into something very different and sour."

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Alla spina. Intenso color giallo scuro lievemente torbido con fragile schiuma bianca saponosa. Fantastico aroma floreale, lievemente fruttato e acidulo con forti sentori di sambuco e zucchero a velo; gusto bilanciatissimo, acetico ma non prorompente con un finale asciutto e delicatamente luppolato. Frizzante e di struttura vivace, morbida e scorrevole al palato. Un lambic eccezionale.

Bottles at Surt med Chris Anker as Zwanze 2009. Had this together with the 2010 Mamouche to compare. First the Zwanze 09. It pours hazy golden with a creamy dense white head. The aroma is loaded with elderflowers and has a acidic edge but its in the background. The flavour is very bitter and has strong notes of grapefruit peel. Lots of elderflowers as well. Bit dusty and very herbal like tart finish. 7/4/7/3/14 
Mamouche 2010. Pours hazy golden with a big white. The aroma is fresh citrussy fruits, elderflowers and some acid. The flavour is quite tart and has quite strong notes of elderflowers but its not as profound as the Zwanze. There are definately differences between the two batches but the elderflowers is really not my thing as its makes a very tart herbal finish. 7/4/7/4/14

Bottle from Ølbutikken, CPH. Pours clear golden with a big frothy white head. Aroma of green apples, sour and light acidic. Taste is mild sour funky barnyard, fresh spicy and yeasty, refreshing and dry. Easy drinkable and enjoyable.

Bottle: Served in a flute: Vintage 2011 (just couldnt wait any longer).
So, now it is time to rate this one. Jean didnt let me buy this one in his shop, but luckily I found it somehere else. I hope he trusts people to sell his nice Lambics to and take them home to share it with friends or drink it alone with time rather than to keep them at the brewery, ah well who am I to say so, the man must  have his good reasons.
More medium than bigger sized, lively and fairly quick fading harsher foamy white head on top of a an almost almost clear yellow colored Lambic. The last filled glasses are good hazy, beautiful equally hazy, looks really nice and even seems to taste better.
The aromas are a sublime mix of mostly flowers and wood, with some good hints of wild yeast, burned rubber, citronella, manure, wet old cellar and a slight hint of sulphur.
The flavours are marked by the typical Cantillon sour wild yeast notes with nice earthy tones, theres stone, tractor tire/rubber, yoghurt, flowers, wet cellar ish, straw, old dried hops and hop flowers, rope, dust, a hint of abricot and a dry touch to it. Well balanced and tasty.
Low to slightly medium carbonation, soft sparkly mouthfeel at first than it turns a bit dry, a good medium body with a slightly fuller tint and a texture between watery and creamy.
Very well balanced, easy drinkable and that smell with those flowers, chapeau! Another really good beer from Cantillon!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Exceptionnelle..En plein dans les fleurs de sureau; si frais ,si équilibrée
Que du Bonheur!

Simply put, delicious. There is a white pepper taste along with the elderflowers which actually taste Green still. I was thinking the elderflower taste may have calmed down a little but it is still potent after a year in the bottle and creates a green apple pucker. Herbal brett, lacto other lambic style sour notes come together well and play perfectly with the flowers. I was not expecting to like this as much as I am right now.

75cl bottle,2012,from Belgiuminabox.Shared with Saun.Poured a hazy golden colour with medium white head which faded quickly.Immediate aroma of elderflower  with grass,hay and lemon following soon after.Taste of elderflower straight away with grass,lemon,hay,slight barnyard all in there too.Very  tasty and interesting lambic done in the way only Cantillon do.Would love the oppurtunity to try this again after 5 years maturing or so but  found it impossible to wait for even 5 weeks!Very nice.
Draught at the Funk N Sour Fest. Hazy gold pour with large foamy head. Aroma is very floral, perfume, a bit fruity as well. Flavor is floral, tart, funky, blue cheese. Dry finish.

A hazed gueuze with a thin white head. In aroma, loads of lactic acid, flower water, very nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice lemony gueuze with light mint leaves, lemon juice, delicious. At the REAL gastropub, Zwanze day, Dec. 1 2012.

Aroma: very floral and herbal, grass, hay, lemon, some earth and funk.  Pours a slightly hazy golden color, white head dissipates to a ring fairly quickly, some spotty lacing.  Flavor: strong herbal notes, berries, cut grass, crisp citrus, some hay and funk, moderately acidic, light malts and a touch of wheat.  Light body, medium carbonation, dry and crisp finish.  Interesting brew.

750ml bottle shared by jsprime with joel, scottatron and myself. bottled june 2012. hazed golden with a white head. fruity floral and fresh pick tomato stem aroma. flavour is more floral and fruity, not much acid in this one yet, needs more time but still great at this age.
Bottle @ home... It pours hazy yellow with a large white head......The aroma is very nice elderflowers!...... The flavor is tart, fruity, sour and elderflowers.... very nice...

Bottle split 3 ways at Prohibition Pig.  Nose is floral, dill pickle, lemon, kiwi, and musty funk.  Taste is nicely tart with a very unique lightly melon sweetness and a floral bite.  I really like this guy.
Bottle at prohibition pig, very floral grassy earthy aroma, sweet tart funky lambic flavor, one if the best cantillon lambics

(bottle) pours a hazy deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of heavy elderflower, young gouda and honey, quite musty in a good way, with notes of kiwi, cactus juice, white grapes and citrus fruit. flavour is heavily vegetal, though not unpleasantly so, with big notes of green peppers, light elderflower, mango, floral hops and a dry finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

split with 77 ships / 2 australian tourists.
smells very much like vegetables, i do not like vegetables! 
taste is quite alike. green vegetables ( broccoli, sprouts, salad,..)
with the cantillon sourness, of course. not my thing, at all! yet i can stil drink it.. respect for the beer and its brewer , but id prefer another cantillon

Bottle provided by Matt for our Saturday couples tasting. Thanks for the tick man! Pours a peach color with a fingers worth of tight white head. Nose is pretty forwardly earthy/herbal, with some pepper, pickle, and lemon. I know its not really pickle, just a weird off characteristic of the elderflower. Flavor is a lot of the same themes, its very sour and that pickle/herbal characteristic is a lot more pronounced. Light mouthfeel, moderate acidity, gentle carbonation, and a lingering finish. Might be my least favorite Cantillon to do. I can see why others would like this, but I think I prefer Iris in comparison to this.

Bottle: hazy straw yellow. Quickly dissappearing frothy head. Aroma: you clearly get the elderflowers. Musty, stable, some funk. Wet wood, brett, Very floral, taste follows  the nose. Nice acidity, not overpowering, some lemon, still a lot of elderflower, some sulfur, very easy to drink, very refreshing.
Draft. Pours golden orange with a white head. Big bretty, lemony citric, and flowery up front, dirty funky in the middle, and a lingering prickly bretty finish. Bangin.

Pours a hazy blonde with a small but well retained head with some lacing on the glass. 

The nose is remarkable, beer wise like nothing else, but still all around familiar. The classic lemony, dusty and funky elements of Lambic are all there, but they almost take a back seat to a harmoniously balanced element of earthy and ditch weedy floweriness. In some way it smells very much like black jack gum as well... which rules. 

The flavor is earthy, both in a way that labmics many times are, but also in a different way as well. Earthy in a sort of way that no other beer Ive ever tasted is. The beer is floral in a sort of dandelion-y way. It is softly bitter with a nicee mild lemon and citrus rind character and sourness. The flavor is something akin to Anise but not quite that, I assume this is the flavor of elderflower and I like whatever it is quite a bit. The oakiness is subdued but noticeable. Everything is in its right place, and while the elderflower takes center stage, at no point does it seem like one is drinking anything other than a Lambic. 


This reminds me of playing on the hill leading up to my grandparents cabin as a child, but at the same time reminds me of being in Brussels last summer. Wow.

Poured from a bottle at Hop & Vine at Zwanze Day 2012, pours a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Nose is full of green peppers, light elderflower and strange spicy notes. Unfortunately, the flavour is almost all green pepper-dominated, with light elderflower, low funk and moderate tartness. The green pepper is way too prominent, dominating the flavour big time. Way too flawed  is this really what they were going for? Not so good  likely the worst Cantillon out there.

Time to give my least favorite Cantillon another shot.  On tap at Zwanze Day 12.

Soft yellow body, marginally hazy.  Thin, white ring of head relaxes on the surface.  Nose is dominated by the distinct aroma of green bell peppers.  Kinda dry too, I suppose, but its nearly impossible for my senses to get past this unpleasant smell.

Taste is similarly overwhelmed by green bell pepper flavors.  Others claim its floral; all I get is green bell pepper though.  Finishes with cracked black pepper and a touch of capsaicin heat (wtf?!).

Jean Van Roy is my hero, but I truly question the decision to blend delicate lambic with a flavor this dominant.  By far the worst lambic Cantillon has produced IMO.

Drinked in bottle at Cantillon Brasserie.
Elderflowers play a fundamental role, really rich aroma,full gold color, heavy-nice sour taste, one of best Cantillon

draft @ Novare Res on Zwanze day. Nose is a pleasant elderberry and yeast. Elderberries are dominate and mildly funky. Yeast and a lemongrass herb or tangy hop. Light lactic acid. Mild tart aftertaste. Light pucker, real nice Lambic!

Tap at spuyten for zwanze day.  Pours yellow with white soapy head.  Nose of citrus and herbal with elder flowers.  Its crisp and tart upfront.  U get elder flowers no prob, also grassy, ginger, pepper, basil, lemons peppers and orange rind.  nice start to this holiest of Lambic holidays

Tap @ Spuyten Duyvil for Zwanze Day 2012.  Pours a cloudy golden with mild orange hue.  Huge,strong, rocky bleach white head that takes forever to dissipate (tapping had to go into pitchers before pouring into glasses).  The aroma was filled with peppery spices and floral notes on top of a lactic sour base.  On the palate, the tart sour notes dominate until the finish when clearly floral and earth notes come through.  Finishes clean and crisp with a mild pepper zing on the end.  Fabulous stuff.  Sessionable if you can find enough of it.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a larger white head of foam. The aroma has intense floral notes. Its reminiscent of the stem of a dandelion, actually. The taste is very sour and bitter plant matter. Refreshing. Kinda of like cucumber water with some lemon juice in it. Real fucking good.

Refrigerated 75 cl green bottle poured into a tulip.  Pours light orange with white head.  Some lacing, medium body, well carbonated, and dandelion aroma.  Taste is musty malt, tart, and dandelion.  Good, but Cantillon has better.
Pours a bright orange with a thick white lacing. Aroma is grape, elderberry and pepper. The flavor is sour and somewhat spicy.

I think of elderberry as a very European flavor. If you have not experienced a homemade elderberry cordial you are missing out and might not get the full effect of this beer. Really captures the light floral and citrus notes. Very refreshing, covers up some of the funk I expect from Cantillon. I forgot how good this is.

Pours golden. Fruity and and clean but prominent lactic sourness with a moderate amount of funk mixed in. Flavor is earthy, funky, clean sour with a smooth character overall and fruity with almost a citrus like acidity. crisp mouthfeel. love this beer.
750ml bottle from cotteridge wines, Birmingham.Hazy blonde with earthy elderflower notes. Initial tartness replaced by fruity floral notes and chalky tastes.

2011 bottle thanks to fredrik_ and Ludvig!
Orange golden with a white head.
Aroma: cantillon, wood, elderflowers.
Taste: elderflowers, flädersaft, lemons, green apples, nice balanced sourness, tart and dry.
Medium bodied.
Very nice, this is a great combination!

Pours a hazy and golden beer with a white head. The aroma is fruit, flowers, some berries, elderflower and notes of tart. The flavor follows the nose with additional bitterness. The palate is sweetness and bitterness. Overall a really good beer.

Rating 1700! Bottle - thanks again Adam! From my shiny new 3 Fonteinen tumbler, thanks for that too, Adam! Pours clear honey-gold, with a thin white head that laces really remarkably badly. Full disclosure: I LOVE Elderflowers! Nose is rosewater, lilac, lily, fresh ginger, orange blossom, apricot, elderflowers... Such an amazing nose. I thought that a big, brash, lambic like Cantillon would disrupt the elderflowers, but nothing could be further from the truth! Flavours of peardrop, flowers, rosewater, Thai basil, salt, still quite juicy. Just delicious!

Bottle.   Hazy orange gold with an initially large foam.  Aromas are peach with grapefruit,  yeast and lemon.   Lovely floral notes with lots of woody aspects.  Funky but not as funky as some other Cantillons.  Flavours are sweet peach soon followed by bags of yeast and lemon.  Tart with clean floral notes and bitter grapefruit juice.  Not had a Cantillon for ages, absence made my heart fonder.  Excellent.

Cask @ Akkurat.

Wow this just hit me in the face with fruitiness. So perfect so great and a lovely sourness. Would like a cask of this one in my home.
Really nice herbal nose.  Taste is herbal and not as sour as a typical Cantillon.   Awesome beer, beautiful sour with floral and herbal notes.
On draft at church key in dc  pours a hazy gold with a white head. Fresh sour berry aroma.  Aged two years.  Really delightful.
UPDATED: OCT 28, 2013 Very nice sour! Medium carbonation. Aroma of elderberry blossom. Sour and sweet, also spicey, some notes of pepper. Interesting!
Bevuta alla spina. Ottima lambic caratterizzata soprattutto da aromi floreali. Bionda con schiuma bianca abbastanza persistente. In bocca è molto fresca e leggermente acida.Buona

75 cl bottle to oversized snifter (shared with the wife; bottled on June 8, 2012.  Looks good; an opaque orange with white lacing.  Smells good; floral and funky.  Some pickle juice too, but not in an aversive way.  Tastes good too; like it smells with a pleasant mouthfeel.  The elderberries add a whole nother level of depth to the base beer (which is already remarkable).
Tasted at Funk N Sour Festival at Jester King Craft Brewery.  Aroma of cat pee.  Overly sour.  Hints of chile pepper and fruit.  Not a fan.

Bottle courtesy of khumbard, thanks Kevin! 750 ml capped and corked bottle served in a Deschutes tulip.

A: Pours a clear golden yellow color with a frothy, pure white head forming on the pour. Some soapy splotches of lace are left down the glass.

S: Some light funk and fresh cut grass are present. Some sweet flowery notes as well, but overall the profile seems somewhat restrained.

T: Dewy grass and sweet flowery notes. Lemon grass, green apple and some light tartness. Restrained funk and tartness on the finish.

M: Light and crisp. Refreshing with spritzy carbonation.

O: The flavors were light and slightly restrained. It was still a nice beer, but wasnt all that tart or sour.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-29-2012
bottle: tasty sweet malt, light candy and fruity. lightly spicey with a great sharp sour. very floral and herbal-like tanins which perfectly balance the lactic notes.
UPDATED: DEC 5, 2016 Elderflower? Ok, is like Violets with pepper and of course... the brett character. An other planet brew. Incredible.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 There is a reason why I love this beer so much! Firstly, I love Cantillon and the taste they manage to get in their beer. but at number two is the love of my childhood, when I was little, I got elderflower juice very often. My beloved father makes the best! and when you mix two of the best things available it sometimes becomes absolutely brilliant! thats how it was when i tasted Mamouche for the first time!




Then there is also the Zwanze 2009, it did not have the same flavor and lovely elderflower aroma! there was someone in the group whom i shared the bottle (at Moeder Lambic) talking about jalapeños which meant that I could not stop thinking about it. of course without the hotness, yet a clear taste of green chilies.
2012.10.06 - sample at brewery (brouwkwintessens Cantillon) - elderflower a little bit overpowering

Bottle. Creamy white good fully lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Heavy nioce sour aroma. Elderflower just present. Heavy bitter wonderfull sour flavor. Long complex nice sour finsh. Creamy palate. World class brew.
Bottle. Huge head with good duration. Color is golden. Arpma and taste are rich brett, peach, apricot, stable, leather, malt and hops.

Purchased this bottle today at Bier Tempel. This is from this years bottling on June 7th. Not sure Ive ever had a Cantillon this fresh before, let alone Mamouche. 
Pours a hazy golden color, with a nice creamy white head that slowly subsides to an off white ring. Aroma is of intense grassy, plant material mixed with a massive floral bouquet with an almost green pepper, spicy quality. 
Tastes pretty much follows the aroma. This is all about the elderflowers! This peppery, floral taste is accompanied by a nice level of subtle tartness. Moderate carbonation, light in body and quite an easy drinking beer. This is by far the most flowery, plant like beer Ive ever tasted. I actually really enjoy it. Lucky to have found this so fresh!

Draught at Akkurat
Sightly hazy golden. Small white head. 
Light and very fresh aroma with a lot of elderflowers. 
Really tart with flowery flavour.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, acidic nose with notes of elderflower, citrus, grapefruit and stable. Fruity, acidic taste with citrus (lemon, grapefruit), fresh hints of elderflower, a touch of sweaty horse and a dry, tart finish with a solid lambic character. Medium body, dry and tart. Very nice lambic.

2010 bottle, 09/22/2012.  Pours orange amber, huge rocky head, great retention on the surface, cohesive lacing. Aroma is earthy, wild flower floral notes, mild green pepper and herbs, finishes with light lambic notes, barnyard. Taste is herbal, floral bitterness, lemon and peach with mild acidity, more funky, dry oak finish. Light palate, very drinkable.  Great stuff.

750ml bottle, 2011 on the cork.  Pours a hazy orange with some thin, fizzy white head.  Lots of apparent carbonation.  Nose is nice, some green bell pepper, floral, lightly herbal, lavender, but mostly just classic Cantillon lambic, grassy, a touch horsey, some honey, some chamomile.  Flavor is more tart, lemony, grass, dandelion greens, herbal, lavender, some sage, chamomile, honey, a little wormwood, green bell pepper, white peppercorns, a little cheese, some orange rind, medicine cabinet.  Full bodied, lightly tart, lightly herbal finish.  While not my favorite Cantillon, still very good.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is light acidic, elderberries and green herbal notes. Flavour is acidic, elderberries, green herbal and leather. Dry aftertaste.
pours gold with no head.  Aroma is herbal with pepper.  Taste follows, peppery and funky, almost like a sour saison but a really good one. really tasty

Bottle @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. The pours deep amber in color with big pillowy white head. Slightly hazy. The aromas very spicy pepper, fresh herbs and light chili powder. The nose is a bit dirty, some dusty yeastiness is present as well as hints of sweet citrus. The taste is more spicy herb garden, chamomile tea and minerals. Some cobweb, peppered cheese. The bodys light and drinkable. Overall, this was a bit too spiced for my tastes. Still, its an interesting beer. Well executed.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is sourness, elderflower, yeast. Flavour is sourness, elderflower, yeast, floral. Nice beer.

(750ml bottled may 16, 2011) clear bright gold, fine white bubbles. Nose of flowers, very funky, light charred wood, fresh meadow, fresh cut grass, extremely complex. Taste is a bit on the vinegar side, acetic acid, pickle juice, aggressively sour and I like it but wish it was more complex than it is. Even so, I really like it.

Bottle shared at Woodshop 7. Light peachy color with a small white head. Strange floral scent, obviously the elderberry flowers. Plenty of acidity but rather subdued flavor, mainly your typical funky lemony citrus pith notes with a touch of bitterness.

Bottle dated 15 June 2010, shared by badnewsbeers. Murky opaque orange sediment-laden body, thin tight off-white head. Nose of wood, dusty, sour, tart and light with no flabby sugars, a beautiful balance of sawdust/cobwebs and funk, puckering. Herbal body with white pepper, fennel, and herbs, dry yet puckering and sour and supremely balanced. Stellar beer.

Smallish white head. Hazy yellow body. Strong wooden vinuous herbal aroma with elderberry, barnyard and flour notes. Dry-acidic vinegary elderberry taste with barnyard and earth notes. Mid-to-thin body. Faintly sharpish mouthfeel. Dry-acidic metallic earthy elderberry aftertaste with earthy mealy wooden vinuous notes. Lovely! That elderberry flavour works very well, fairly clear and prominent, too. (0.75l bottle, Olympen, Oslo.)

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy blond with low white head, diminishing. Aroma is of funk, barnyard, citrus, lactic acid, flowers. Taste is of funk, barnyard, lactic acid (alot), ligth bitterness, flowers. Overall: a very good beer, not easily drinkable.

Bottle 750 ml. Hazy orange with a small persistent white head and some lacing. Aroma is funk, elderflower, wood and barnyard. Taste is fruits (citrus), floral, lactic acid, moderate but long lasting acidic presence and wood. Dry and refreshing. One of my favorite Cantillon.

750mL bottle, 2011.  This is a Cantillon, not sure about the elderberry thing, but definitely Cantillon.  Not quite as acidic as some other brews of theres, so that is good.  I dont need to go into more details b/c its Cantillon but less acidic.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Many thanks to Eugene for sharing - lightly hazy pour - moderately effervescent - nose has the distinct Cantillon funk to it, as well as moderate white grape sweetness/white wine tannic character and light acetic notes - flavor is quite dry, but with restrained acetic and lactic notes (for Cantillon, anyway) and moderate cheesy funk - there is also a touch on bitterness to it - finish is of an earthy, dry white wine - there is a touch of plastic-like phenols far in the back in the finish that detract a little bit from the enjoyment, but otherwise this is nice, balanced, restrained beer from Cantillon.

Bottle shared by Puddintane at Muckfest III...thanks Dave! - Pours amber with a thin off-white head. Flowers are apparent on the nose, with lots of tartness, light citrus, and a real gentle maltiness. Nice acetic tartness in the taste, with flowers, light citrus--very dry. Smooth, well-carbonated, and a light, fluffy body. Everything about this beer is gentle and delicate, expect the tartness. Great stuff.
i fiori di sambuco donando dolcezza e amabilità a questa cantillon, senza però tralasciare limportanza dellacidità che resta preminente.

Zwanze 2009 very generously shared by ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad!

A: Appears a very hazy straw color with a huge head and copious amounts of lacing. Much more head and lacing than I was expecting from a Cantillon brew.

S: OK...this is shockingly different than any beer I have ever smelled. Huge herbal and floral aromas combined with an intense scent of what can only be elderflowers. Points for intrigue, originality, allure and potency. Wow...

T: Again, a taste unlike anything I have ever had. Peppers, peppercorn, vegetable garden, chiles, jalapenos, pickles, and flowers. What a combination. If you could imagine drinking an herb & vegetable garden, this is it. Normally, when one describes a beer as tasting vegetal, the statement carries a negative connotation. Not the case here - a special experience for your taste buds provided by Cantillon.

M: Zwanze 2009 is unique in every aspect. The finish is quite dry with pronounced floral notes.

D: Profoundly interesting. What an experience. This is a great beer to share with a few folks. I am thrilled at the opportunity to try this rare delicacy.

Thank you Gabriel for sharing! 2010 bottle pours bright hazy apricot color with large off white head that falls slowly. The smell is big elderflower, green bitter plants, mild malt sweetness. The taste followes that smell initially...then some of the Cantillon sourness comes in but not overly so.  There is some wood and grapefruit flavor and accompanying dryness on the finish. Delicate carbonation and light body. Overall a very interesting brew and a real treat.
Bottle. Musty floral lemon, oak, and vinegar aroma.  Golden yellow with small head.  Sweet-tart floral, lemon, and light vinegar flavor.  Full body.  Heavenly.

Honey gold with a small off-white cap.
Scent is funky-vinegar and wet oak barrel.
Taste is woody,funky,tart-sour wood and fruit......very dry.
Bottle. Sweet fruity floral, woody, herbal vinegar aroma. golden with a large white head. Funky Belgian yeast, tart, spicy oaky, citric flavor. Light, dry astringent body.

18-JUN-2012, bottle @George & Dragon, during "Un Mare di Birra".
Cloudy orange with off-white head.
Very flowery aroma with distinct elderflower and fruity notes of apricots. Citric and fruity tart. Long and smooth.
Really smooth and certainly not as sour as I expected. A fantastic drink.

On tap with Allen, Eric and some other beer heads. Poured an ultra hazy straw gold color, thin head and lacing. Aromas of skunk, fresh green pepper, cheese, berries, wood and grapefruit. Taste is jalapeno, lactic yeasts, elderberries, oak, melons, herbs, lemon peel. Ultra tart yet refreshing. One of the most diverse tasting and smelling sours i have had from them. Awesome.

Draft.  Excellent. Tart citrus and floral aroma.  Well balanced funky and musty and dry and sour and quenching.  In general I find the Cantillon beers great, with strong "house character" and then various divergents based on the tweak. This time the elderflower, which I dont have any experience with, but works well.

750 ml bottle shared at Markwises place, poured a light yellow color, aromas of lemon, light barnyard, light floral aroma, and light oak.  Flavors are the same, mostly light lemon flavors, and not overly tart.

@markwise Birthday-palooza-a-go-go Gathering-750ml bottlethanks markwise-pours yellow/gold with a white head.  Aroma is tart lemon, light malt.  Taste is acidic/tart lemon, horse blanket, light malt.

14 karat pour with a petite ivory head that vanished quickly.  Nose of ripened lemons, unripe peach and tangerine, light herbs and aromatic flowers.  Flavor begins fairly aggressive and tart but finishes quickly.  Funk but fairly drinkable.  Enjoyed it.

In bottle at the 21st Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. Pours a dark golden colour with a fair white head. Aroma of elderflowers, peach, lemon and oak. Similar flavours and nicely tart with a dry finish. Just a little sweet with mild carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Great!

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2013 Poured from draft @ Novare Res Deep straw color with a bright fizzy white head that dissipates quickly. Aromas are loaded with sour tart notes but this one has a bit of herbal, grassy undertones that is a bit different from any others Ive had.  On the palate its pure tart funk that starts of crisp and acidic but rounds out nicely on the finish... nothing to atypical about this Cantillon till the finish when there was a nice backround of sour berry... green pepper. Nice !

75cl bottle @ home. Bottled 16 May 2011. Hazy golden blond to light amber coloured beer with lots of carbonation and a small white head. Nice very refreshing herbal and almost citrus fruity hinted aroma. Full light creamy hinted palate. Finish is bitter sour balanced with some delicate herbel sweet sour fruity hints. Very subtile flavours beautifully balanced. Very nice.

Draught (Moeder Lambic, Fontainas, Brussels) - Hazy gold/amber with a small white head. Elderflower, lemon and musty elements in the aroma. Tart and tangy taste with notes of elderflower and lemon standing out. Really refreshing.

Green bottle, 75 cl, bottled on June 15 2012, best before June 15 2020,via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on May 6 2012; eye: polished copper, almost clear, average effervescence, voluminous white head that falls and turns into a tiny sheet, no lacing; nose: Brettanomyces yeast, floral, tree fruit, wood, peppery; mouth: Brettanomyces yeast, floral, tree fruit, acidity, sourness, wood, peppery, finale in tree fruit with light presence of pleasant sourness, medium-full body, good carbonation, slightly sweet, refreshing, slick texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille verte, 75 cl, embouteillée le 15 juin 2010,	meilleure avant 15 juin 2020, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 6 mai 2012; il : cuivre poli, presque limpide, effervescence moyenne, mousse blanche abondante qui tombe et se transforme en une mince couverture, pas de dentelle; nez : levure Brettanomyces, floral, fruit darbre, bois, poivré; bouche : levure Brettanomyces, floral, fruit darbre, acidité, aigreur, bois, poivré, finale en fruit darbre avec présence dune légère aigreur agréable, corps moyen-corsé, bonne carbonatation, très légèrement sucrée, rafraîchissante, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

From bottle, shared by someone whos on the other beer site. Poured a mostly clear, with slight haze dark-yellow color with a medium sized white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma has tart, sour notes that dominate the beer, crisp, like slightly sour fruit. Flavor is puckering tartness, with sour fruits and a touch of herbal and floral goodness. Very enjoyable!

0.75l bottle courtesy of Meilby and shared with The Kristiansandsmafia. This one pours a fantastic looking blurry golden body with a big lasting almost fluffy white head. On the aroma this is really subtle fruity, mild mild sour. It has a average carbonation level and a light oily texture in the mouth. Flavors are mild sour and actually on the border of gastric acid. Not in a bad way, but I get clear references. Its fruity and floral indeed with hints of melon and strawberries. Towards the ending a near pungent herbal twitch thats a bit confusing. This was a nice and non-extreme sour. Big thanks for sharing Meilby! 30.03.2012
Pours gold into a tumbler. Bright white micro head with excellent retention, Brett, leather, and pear aromas. Tart summer pit fruit upfront turning to honey before the lasting earthy citrus finish.

Thanks to eaglefan538 for sharing this with me.  Straw colored pour with frothy head and a fruity aroma.  Just mouth-puckering tart, lightly fruity with pear and apple flavors.  Just so funky.  The cork had some kind of primordial sludge on it that made me slightly fearful, but this was delightful.  I need more Cantillon.

Poured into a tulip. 2011 vintage. I always wondered why this is categorized as a fruit lambic since as far as I know, flowers arent fruit.

3.5 A: Lightly hazed yellow orange color. Two and a half fingers of foamy white head. Retention is mediocre and no lacing is left.

4.5 S: Plenty of musty, earthy, and dirty funk in this. Pond water, sweat socks, diaper to start. Rotting peachiness, woody, lightly astringent. Lemongrass, lemon zest. The elderflowers offer a pleasant herbalness along with something along the lines of an Anaheim pepper. Fairly dry and without a lot of acidity. Perhaps a touch of lactic acid with no acetic to be found.

3.5 T: There is a surprising sour kick in the taste though. Its not super intense, but it gets the job done. Also a much bigger bitterness and tannic astringency. Perhaps its the elderflowers that add this bitterness. I wouldnt know since I dont go into fields and munch on whatever I see. Lighter pepperiness in the taste. Lightly herbal. Dirty diaper is back along with sweat socks and pond water. Lemon and peachy fruitiness. Very oaky with a rotting wood component. Again, on the drier side.

3.5 M: Not bad here, but it could use a bit more spritz and more creaminess. Lighter body. Active carbonation. Mildly astringent aftertaste.

3.5 D: This was good and I loved the nose, but its too bitter for my preference and the astringency is a bit distracting. Im not sure that Ill buy this again, but it was worth a try.

Serving type: bottle

Bottle.  Clear yellow pour with a white head.  Herbs and what I assume is elder flower aromas.  Sour and tart with classic Cantillon citrus/lemon notes and some herbal/floral additions.  Not my favorite Cantillon, but still a very nice beer.

Draught at Blind Tiger.  Deep orange/yellow, layered with no head.  Nose is woody, spicy peppers, some fruity acidity, dust, earth.   Flavor is similar, the peppers just kinda take over everything for me and kinda ruin the beer for me, sadly.  I still had two, just cuz.  But probably my least favorite cantillon Ive had.

Bottle from Robert at SL, cuz hes a darned swell guy. Pour was hazy straw colored with a very generous head. I might add that between the cap and the cork was major wetness and the cork oozed wetness after wiping it of ickity funky sickening black stuff. Why do we drink this highly septic unhygenic stuff? Sushi is tasty and it has to be safer? Anyway, the aroma was very nice, oak/wood/sawdust, tart apples, bret, leather, horseblanket. The flavor is all of that, some floral elements, sharply tart but not utterly sour. Finishes pretty crisp and clean with a zip. Firm carbonation. A great and refreshing brew, bring on the horseblankets, baby!

On draft. Pours Hazy orange with a thin white head. Aroma of Peach and sour fruit with floral notes. Tart fruit on the palate, some Peach and soft Elderflower. wonderful mouth feel with sprightly carbonation , well balanced overall with a super dry finish.

Bottle. Pours clear, deep gold with thick, frothy white head; good retention and spare lacing. Aroma is white wine, spicy peppers, pears, cereal malt, garlic, funky cheese, and faint grassy hops. Flavor is heavy sour fruit esters and spice with some supporting sweet malt; chardonnay undertones throughout with a dry finish. Light body, medium carbonation, and low warmth.

Bottle.  Pours nearly clear orange with a large, frothy white head, medium-long retention with good lacing.  Aroma is herbal, cheese, barnyard, horse blanket, onion/garlic, black pepper, straw and wheat malt, faint spicy/dank hops and sour fruit (blueberry/currant).  Flavor is tart, sour, and light lactic bright fruit, black pepper, onion, vegetables, light malt and hops, faint bitterness, barnyard and cheese with a dry finish.  Light body and warmth, medium carbonation.
Pours a hazy golden. Tart with mellow aromas of grapefruit and eldeberry flowers and grapes. Medium to full bodied. Soft carbonation.

bottle at black friday tasting 11/25/11.

hazy yellow with a small white head.

it smells of flowers... lots of em mixed with garbage, dust and champagne vinegar.

the flavor shares the same notes but adds in damp earthiness and sulfured dry apricots. it is really floral and sour but balanced as well.

sharp prickly carbonation makes it way too easy to drink!. 8/4/8/4/17

Sample from a shared bottle @Schouskjelleren. Near clear gold colored. Thin, short-lived white bubble head.  Tart and funky citrus aroma with hint of perfume and flowers. Lemon fruity and acidic-sour floral flavor. Very refreshing and not too hard on the palate. Softly carbonated. Light in body. Refreshingly tart and fruity/flowery finish. Nice, indeed.

Bottle @ Ølbutikken, 2005 vintage. Draught @ Mikkeller. Deep golden color, impressive head. Elderflower aroma thick as perfume, gorgeous. White pepper, ctirus. Sweetness followed by extreme tartness. Body is strong with high carbonation. Beware puckering.

Acquired this in a trade. Thanks Ryan! Poured into a champagne flute and Ommegang glass. Bottling date is June 2010. Stored at Cellar temp around 55 Degrees F since bottling.

This is a capped and corked beer. As soon as I popped the cap off, the cork started sliding out of the bottle. I tried to stop it but the cork flew out and dented my ceiling and Cantillon starting spewing everywhere. I did my best and held my thumb over the top with two hands. Intense carbonation unlike any other lambic Ive seen. Wow. 

A - Gigantic carbonation in this beer. Even on a slow pour, bubbles invade the glass producing a 5-7 finger head almost instantly. The bubbles are big, impressive and unforgiving. It takes about 3 minutes for the big bubbles to dissipate and Im left with only an ounce of beer. This beer FORCES you to drink it slowly. This is a 5 on the SRM rating for appearance. Dark gold to cedar color in appearance. Not easy to see through and a hint of clouds. After a few minutes, the head is just a quarter finger with some lacing on the glass edges.

S - Im getting a lot of wood, earth and funkiness on the first scent and a really hard habanero or chili pepper burn in the back of my throat. Theres a bit of dried fruits like raisins or papaya. Very tropical fruit scent to this beer. Theres also a big musty scent like dust and old wood. Very intriguing.

T - This has that taste of a very old lambic 4-6 years or more old. The floral notes are actually not that intense. Im getting oak and apricot and chili peppers. Theres this spice thats more like table pepper. Its pretty amazing. I also get honeysuckle and that great lambic funkiness.

M - Almost no carbonation on the mouth swish. Lingering spice and earthiness and tart.

O - This beer is fantastic. Theres no huge taste other than the peppers and Im not a fan of spicy beers. This is unlike anything Ive ever had. Solid A but Id love more sour and less carbonation on the pour.
Bottle from Systembolaget. It poured a foggy golden liquid with a small white head. Fresh and fruity smell with elderberries. Funky taste with horse blanket and gooseberries. A very nice lambic.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden orange with small white head. Falls away very quickly. Aromas of lemony sourness and red peppers. Quite spicy and sour and the same time. Some earthy funk in support. Flavours show acidic sourness. Not overly powerful but nicely balanced. Medium mouthfeel. Great beer.

Bottle, courtesy of Meilby. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of sweet elderflower, lemon, leather, funk and wood. Flavor is sour and tart with some elderflower notes, dry finish and funk. Medium body, average carbonation.Nice and tart with some sweet elderflower.

Bottle 750ml @ Geokkjer
Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of funk and elderflower. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium sour with a long elderflower, sour and dry finish. Body is full, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, 75cl, courtesy of Meilby. A hazy one, golden in color and with a small, dense, white to off-white head. Lightly peppery, quite elderflowery aroma with a grassy touch and some lemon. Maybe a bit on the flowery side, but really pleasant anyway. The same goes for the flavor, the elderflowers overpowers the flavors normally found in a lambic, but its really pleasant. Not really sure if I could drink a lot of it, but Id probably enjoy sharing a bottle. Medium body, tart and quite nicely carbonated. Anyway, I like it a lot. 120330

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2012 Bottle shared with Streets and Ben at EMP. Pours a light golden body with nice haze, and a thick carbonated fizzy white head. Aroma is absurd and unique - notes of not just a full, floral bouquet, but it goes beyond that - trees, roots, earthy textures, moss, floral funk, and a touch of fruit. Mouthfeel is fantastic, with the perfect amount of acidity, and notes of funk and sour fruit and ends abruptly with a bitter earthiness. Incredibly unique beer from Cantillon.
Bottle at DRBM. The aroma has elderberries, some citrus, slightly tart. Hazy, yellow-orange coloured beer with a slightly off-white head. The taste is sourish, yeasty and has a lot of elderberries.

Style et résumé:  Lambic aromatisé aux fleurs de sureau.

La bouche est acide comme il se doit, il y a beaucoup dépice, du chili, cest piquant. La fin de bouche surprend par le côté très piquant. Sans être la meilleure cest un produit très appréciable. Chapeau Cantillon.

reviewed 09-10-2011. 2010 cork. pours a very hazy vibrant golden yellow. very impressive head that just sits there all puffy and what not. smells like a flower, what else? hints of pear and apple with a slight sour lemon. a deep funk beneath. very bitter with a fresh flower flavor. almost tastes like biting into the stem of a flower. a hint of funk and lemon through out. a nice light oak flavor through out. the oak seems to compliment the elder flower. elder flower really comes out in the finish and lingers. nice and dry with a light body and moderate carbonation. interesting although at the same time the elder flower really comes off strong.

(75 cl.  Embouteillée le 16 mai 2011)  Un beau corps doré bien trouble.  Une tête blanche toute en largesse.  Un nez qui est très floral et très pimenté.  Unique!  On est aussi très collé aux soubresauts habituels de la maison.  Comment ne pas aimer la signature Cantillon?  Donc, au-delà des délicates fleurs et des piments broyés, une salve bien nourrie par les citrons et par la douce folie des microbes.  Les saveurs sont aussi dominées par les fleurs aux pétales épicés et par un aspect rustique tout à fait charmant.  Des notes aigres qui sépanchent sur ma langue et des notes surettes qui grandissent avec intelligence.  Les instances citronnées qui prévalent dans le premier verre sont accompagnées un peu plus loin par la franche et jeune camaraderie des raisins blancs.  Limpression que laisse en bouche ce liquide est mené par une main de maître: le corps est sculptural tandis que le pétillement est soutenu.  Et la texture, une caresse pour la langue.  Difficile de faire mieux.   En finale, une ode aux notes poivrées et asséchantes.  Franchement, un pur délice.

On tap at Moeder Lambic St Gilles a few weeks ago.  From notes, Pours transparent and gold with a small white head.  Nose is grassy and a bit hoppy but I know this is from the elderberry flower.  Bit of sour peak through in the form of lemon and vinegar.  Great floral boquet overall.  Tast is sweet up front but gives way to a sour and bitter finish.  Long lasting aftertaste. Soft. Subtle.  Wonderful on tap, but I think I prefer the bottle with some age.

From notes.  First reviewed 1/23/2012.  Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a snifter. 5/16/2011 bottle.

This looks a lot liek a gueuze. A light golden straw color, transparent everywhere and even more clear at the edges.

A soft floral sweetness dominates the aroma, with a soft funky back. Lemon zest, white pepper, and some biscuity malt provide support. 

The flavor starts and stays tart, with an overlaying flowery sweetness. There is a lemon zest sourness that closes out the flavor. Lemon tartness and some floral funkiness dominate the flavor, but it works out well, unlike Iris. 

The body and carbonation, like the appearance, are standard Cantillon. Medium, slightly creamy carbonation, and a medium body.

I was pleasantly surprised by this; I was expecting something similar to Iris, which I did not like, but instead it was more like a slightly floral Classic Gueuze, which is great. I would drink this again for sure.

draft @ moeder lambic.  Floral herbal aroma.  Pours golden blonde with a white head.  Floral notes come out first with a strong tartness with citrus and pineaplle notes.  The herbal flavors balance the tartness quite well.  Excellent!

Thanks to dimenhetfield for opening this.  The nose has a distinct chili pepper smell and was also floral.  The taste mixed those same things with a nice tartness.  Very unique.  Not like any other sour Ive ever had.

Bottle split amongst friends. Been wanting to try this for some time  now. Very pleasant aroma. Hints of flowers and sourness. Flavor wasnt in your face sour but just enough to make you pay attention. Great beer from Cantillon.

Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is dominated of elderflowers, some funky notes in the background. Not as tart as many lambics, weird oily-like texture (not unplessant). Elderflowers in the taste aswell.

Tasted at the Triple Rock Sour and Barrel Aged Fest on 2/12/2011. This fruit lambic pours a medium orange gold color from a 750ml bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head. The funk, must, barnyard, tartness and sweetness are equally blended in this beer. Lively carbonation. Expertly layered. WOW. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly tart.

This poured a semi cloudy yellow colorw ith a white head. Aroma was light funk, grass, herbal and earthy notes, and soem flowers too. Flavor was medium tartness, light funjk, and then an onslaufght of a strange herbal character, must be the fruit?

Had this at Ratebeers Horny Devil Pittsburgh Winter Tasting 2012. Big thanks Justin Lithy! I never thought I would have the chance to have this beer clear my lips and so for this opportunity I am very grateful.  Big tart farmy aroma, typical cantillon. Clear, almost pale lager in appearance but has a little orange in there.  No head. Has a meaty mild friendly olfactory.  Easy titillating fun on the taste buds. Easy and nifty to say the least. A very refined limbic at that. Is not over the top and is friendly to sip. Goes down the hatch with a happy feeling. A very good sour co2 feel that I really enjoy. Unique in its after taste. Smooth fine sizzle. Overall a really cool beer experience and I have lithy to thank for it.

text: Pale yellow, white ring.  Aroma is mild tartness, light earthy.  Taste is more lightly acidic tartness, some floral, earthiness.

Bottle via maneliquor, thanks again!  2011 bottle.  Pours a light yellow/golden color with frothy head that dissipates.  Aroma, after warming to cellar temps is jalapeno and green bell pepper through and through. Earthy notes come out as well as non floral flower pedal.  This is an amazing smelling beer at 55-60 degrees!  Taste is more of pepper and some very slight sour notes. This one just screams to me as a spring/summer beer.  Drinkable beyond compare and overly balanced beyond any Cantillon Ive had to date.  Looking to get more of this whenever I can.  JALAPENO SOUR!

text: Bottle courtesy of brainlair.  Orange yellow pour with a white hazy head.  Smeels like nature.  Some flowery notes. Roasted green pepper and tomato.  Herbal grassy flavor.  Green pepper and plant roots.  Sour but not overly so.

Bottle shared at Yazoo release party. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Bold funky aroma. Nice assertive flavors (funk, herbs, tart lemons) with a semi dry finish. Very complex and wonderful. I enjoyed this more than the 1900 and Classic Gueze.

This is a wonderful beer.  I had this on tap at the Avenue Pub in New Orleans.  Served in a wine glass.  The small white head stuck around for a while.  The smell and taste was the classic cantillon with a slight change from the elder flowers.  This is a world class beer and my second favorite fruit cantillon behind Fou Foune.  If you can find it get it.  You will not be disappointed.

Rating #2800 - Pours clear copper / amber with a large white head.  The aroma has smooth tartness, interesting fruitiness, white grapes, citric acid, huskiness, buggy wild yeast and some floral poweriness.  Medium body that is very crisp and finishes with gentle carbonation.  The flavor starts with the aroma traits and is quite dry with lots of pepper aspects.  There is a tangy fruitiness which may be the elderberries.  Very bright and refreshing.  The finish has some peppery tartness with some lemony acidity.  Excellent lambic.
Bottle at triple rock Sour Sunday. Poured a Cloudy orangish/yellow pour. Aroma was very funky and wet dog. Taste was mildly tart with a overload of floral edelberry which was a bit over the top.

From bottle at Triple Rock Sour Beerfest. Pours cloudy golden with a modest tangerine head and a magnificent sour fruit aroma. There is a delicate floral fruit flavor with a tangy feel. The elderflower flavor is just slightly astringent but adds a nice layer to the palate.

On tap at the Avenue Pub in NOLA.  Pours a cloudy amber with a white head.  Nose is of funk, cheese and subdued fruit.  Taste is of sour lemon and grapes with some cheese.  Mouthfeel is thin, tart, wet, crisp and acidic.  Good, but not blow me away Cantillon like some of their others.

Courtesy of rlgk. Pours hazy golden amber with a nice off white head. Aroma is brännässlor, stable, sour, floral and dry. Flavor is sour, tart, floral, lemon juice, fläder, unkel and bitter. Finishes longlived tart snd sour bitter.

Bottle at "Alex surölsprovning 2012". Elder aroma, sourish, grapes, stable, fruity, oaky notes, floral. Fruity flavor, citrus, elderflowers, floral, grapes, sour, horse blankett, sourish, some grapes. Long sourish finish.

My Bottom Line:
Boisterous elderflowers move into citrusy funk, as subdued acidity and fluffy effervescence make for a compelling summer brew.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A tower of foam tops the hazy blond.
-That aroma is pure elder flower. I loved it, but it kind of masks the complexity of what is to come in the flavor profile.
-Im even getting hints of saffron; cant say thats happened often when drinking beer...
-The flavor profile is quite Saison-like. The drinkability helps a lot too; this is not of those super acidic lambics.
-Cantillon keeps making these very impressive new creations AND their staples are consistently excellent. I dont see myself stopping to encourage them any time soon.

Bottle.

Hazy peach pour with a thin white head. The aroma can only be likened to wandering through a bramble patch on a 90 degree summer day with the sun beating down. Hot plant and green pepper, but in a really good way. Vibrant juicy acidity and and funky, mildly herbal funky finish, ending bone dry. Awesome!
on tap at the Blue Monk, thanks Mike. straw golden color. nose is tart acidic, some funk. flavor is big very tart, lemon, some barnyard. really nice. so cool having Cantillon on tap
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo. straw/golden pur. Big earthy funk, acidic aroma. tart/ acidic flavor, honey earthiness. Very good

Tap @ Blue Monk.  Hazy gold, tiny head.  Nose is pepper, orange, cantillon house funk, hay-like malt.  Flavor is orange, nice tartnes, honey, light alcohol, a bit of hot pepper (which Im told is from the flowers).  Nice lemony orange finish with wood and funk.
Tap, pours a nice bright yellow. Lots of funk in the aroma. Taste is a very nice sour that finishes with a nice smooth fruitiness. Very solid body. Really enjoyed this one
UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 Draft @ blue monk. Pours a hazy light amber. Nose of pure funk, earth, lemon, flowers. Taste is... sublime. Sour, funky, earthy, bone dry.  Amazing.  Wild!

2011 version

Lots of spicy smoked peppers with lemon, green apple, and elderflowers. 
Crisp, clean, and dry finish. 

Nice beer and a lot of different flavors and smells that you do not see with Cantillon . Works well

Zwanze 2009. Pour is a hazed golden amber with a tight bubly head. The nose has the dusty funk found in so many cantillons with notes of lemon and a huge blast of flower petals. There is a hot type spice and its a little seedy. The taste follows the nose, juicy citrus up front, a dusty funk takes over with the huge flower petal that takes over. A jalepeno spice has an interesting presence with more citrusy flavors and some light bitterness. The body is light and creamy but has an active carbonation and a very dry finish. Extremely unique beer, rare flavors I havent seen before.

Bottle from Beer Planet.
Pours beautifully compact golden, with a big head.
Fruity and tart, thirstquenching and summeish taste of elder.
Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a white head. This is a highly drinkable beer. Sweet and sour. The elderflowers takes some edge of the sourness. Dry.

Flaske: Stor duft af hyldeblomst allerede fra proppen. Øllen ligner en klassisk Cantillon geuze, med det tvist at foruden den klassiske sure stald er der det hint af hyldeblomst i duften der gør den ekstra interessant. Smagen er sur men ikke overvældende. I det hele taget en super lækker øl.

Golden with a small white head. Strong elderflower aroma with classic Cantillon funk and an equally strong note of the green part of the elderflowers - the cabbage-like part I dont like to smell in any beer. Sweet for a Cantillon, with elderflowers and elderflower green

Wow. So Im sitting outside at avenue pub in new Orleans on a nice sunny day drinking this hazy goldeny light Orange beer with good freinds. The beers floral earthy tart and wild funk compliments the smell of the flowers in the planter boxes on the balcony. Taste is like a fun summer day with white pepper lemons basil tarragon.

1/21/12. On tap. Hazy orange pour with a nice khaki head that sticks. Funky, floral aroma with plenty of tartness and an innate dryness. Big funky, yeasty flavor that is nice and tart and surprisingly loaded with flowery aspects. Niiiiice!

On tap at Avenue Pub. Pours a cloudy orange with thick frothy off white head that diminishes rather quickly. The aroma is floral hops and citrus. Thin mouthfeel with a sweet fruit flavor and crisp finish. So refreshing and easy to drink. Wow really enjoyed this one.

May 2011 Bottle. Orangish amber with an white head. Aroma of elderflowers, overripe lemons, yoghurt, Thai chilli peppers (!). Creamy mouthfeel. Mild sourness, lots of flowers, fruity and astringent pepper. Lovely balance and the finish has tartness then wood departing to leave only flowers. Full of life. Quite delightful.

Enjoyed at the Black Friday Tasting pouring up murky copper with gold hues and near white head. The aroma is full of complex and vexing notes of brussel sprouts, pepper, body odor and some vinegar. The taste starts on the tart side as well as refreshing with funky yeast, vinegar tartness, soured citrus notes and sort of a garden salad like earthiness. This is cool as it isnt over the top harsh tartness but delivers depth and balance.

Bottle @ home. Mamouche is corked and then capped yet still gushed a bit when I popped the cap before I took out the cork. It has a cloudy, yellow-orange appearance with a big white head. Fairly floral, moderately to highly sour, lemon tart, brett funky aroma. Moderately to highly sour, tart lemon citrusy, herbal and floral, tangy, funky flavor. Fairly funky, tart finish. The floral element is actually really nice and complements it the sourness quite well.

Bottle from EtreGourmet webshop, consumed between the old and the new year 2011/2012. :-) Pours a nearly pinkish-hued cloudy orange body with a large, frothy white head. Nose is tart lemon, funky brett notes and lots of floral tones which I can only assume come from the elderberry flowers. Hints of lime, stomach acid and apple vinegar. Very complex. Taste is matching: tart lemony tones up front, then a soft carpet of elderberry flowers spread out before twists of barnyard funk, dry hops and herbal tones fade out. Finish is mildly tart and bitter, with a lot of acidic tones. The flowers are evident in the aftertaste as well. A very original lambic that I quite enjoyed as my pick for the New Year. Cheers for 2012 everyone! :-)

Thanks Casey! .. Pours a light yellow .. light spotty lacing .. medium head for a lambic .. . flowers, funk, light wood, and more light flowers .. . clean as a razor, great feel to it .. . even tastes fresh, great stuff.. . the beer of the day- easy .. . . When you go in for a job interview, I think a good thing to ask is if they ever press charges..

750 ml bottle bought @ Olbutikken and consumed on December 15. Pours golden with a white head that dissipates rather quickly without leaving much trace. Smell has tons of elderberries combines with some hay, grass and leather. Taste is dry, sour, bitter and tart with elderberries, hay, leather, lemon zest, grapefruit and funk. Furnish is dry with a nice bitterness to it.

Served from a bottle on Zwanze day 2011 at Monks.
A - Pours hazy yellow with a nice one and a half finger tall white head leaving little to no lace down the glass.
S - Smells of lemon zest, flowers, fresh cut grass, damp earth, and some light funk. A bit of spice begins to come thru as it warms in my hand.
T - Starts off with a big lemony twang slowly giving way to a mix of elderflowers, dry oak tannins, light barnyard funk, and plenty of peppery spice. The finish is a mix of light funk and spice, lingering on the pallet for some time.
M - Medium body and flavor with moderately high carbonation. Light, tart, feel with fairly active carbonation. Compared to some of the other Zwanzes this one had one of the better feels.
O - Very nice. I would have to say this was my least favorite of the three but it was still very good none the less. Glad I finally got to try it.

(bottle shared by Nick at Black Friday)!  Pours a cloudy yellow color with white head.  Aroma is herby, floral and some cheese.  Taste is sour with the herbs and flowers taking center stage.  This was a good beer and quite unique.
My first taste of Cantillon. This is a complex puppy. Very earthy in both taste and smell, happy to have tried it!
Bottle at Black Friday tasting. Aroma-coffee grounds and pepper? What the hell? Tastes just incredible. Sweet onions and socks.
Another great beer from the masters!! Enjoyed this beer very much
Pours a amber with a small off-white head. The aroma is sweet sour, fruity and light acid. The taste is flowery light sour fruity and acid.

Bottle. Pours a nice hazy orange color with a small white head. Aroma is of elderflower, funk like horse blanket and barnyard, vinegar, apple, pear and floral notes. The flavor is pretty sour but very well balanced, the tartness fades pretty quickly giving a nice elderflower flavor, I also get some horse blanket and barnyard funk, floral notes, white grape, vinegar, green apple and pear. The body is light with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a pretty nice fruit Lambic, and I really like how the elderflower balances so well with the sourness.
One of my favourite beers!!!!Sambuco is well present with intense aroma and taste.Definitely a very good beer.

Hazy amber color with a small off-white head. Aroma is very fresh, tons of fruits, primarily elderflower, tangerine, orange, flowers brett and sour berry-notes. Taste is also fresh and fruity. Plenty of complex fruits and hop-notes with a tropic heritage. The taste has lots of bitterness as well. Very exotic.

Bouteille verte de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de sureau avec une pointe de pamplemousse. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goûte dépices et de sureau avec une pointe dagrumes. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de pamplemousse en arrière goût. (Rating #3930)

Bottle @ DRBM. A clear yellow colored beer, with a thick white head. The aroma of sour fruits, elderberries. The taste of sour with a little sweet fruits like apricot with some wood. The aftertaste is sour with a little bitter notes.

Bottle - 750ml. Beautiful hazy golden body with a huge, lasting white foamy head. Strong hoppy aroma with fruity, herbal, and honeyish hints. Its sharp, intense taste is dominated by hoppy flavors and carries flowery notes. Ends with a strong, long sour finish. Very good example of Lambic.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2015 
75 cl bottle @ home, bottled 16.05.2011, BBE 16.05.2021
Sourish and a bit tart aroma has lots of elderflower, some earthy notes and hints of grapefruit. Cantillon house aroma is strong on this one. Palate is surprisingly smooth and low on CO2. Flavour is sour, somewhat acidic and a bit tart with elderflowers, sour apples and some earthy notes. The sourness and earthy notes linger in the aftertaste for a very long time. Feels more like a gueuze with spices than fruit lambic. Refreshing and good!

Draught @ Pikkulintu
